description:
While our friends were waiting in line for Mama's on Washington Square Brunch, a couple of us ventured out to get some delicious pizza and Tony's was on our list.

We decided to buy two slices here and two slices elsewhere just to try!

This is the To Go version of the restaurant next door. We got the Sicillian and the My Potato and my goodness both looked so delicious. We had a taste right away and wow! BOTH WERE DELICIOUS!!

The My Potato Pizza definitely won the crowd though. Very different and unique and flavorful where as the Sicillian was very delicious and flavorful as well but it's sort of a combo pizza!

WOULD VERY MUCH RECOMMEND!
author: Katelin N.

description:
Glad I don't have to travel all the way to NY for some good ol' ny pizza. This place is a good alternative to the original Tony's restaurant. More suitable for those looking for a quick bite, avoiding the long wait at the restaurant and/or wanting to try out a slice vs. getting the entire pie.

They don't have a ton of variety, but they have the main ones. The slices are huge with a generous amount of toppings.
author: Helen C.

description:
Skip the OG Tony's next door and grab slices! Delicious and exactly as expected. Super sized slices on the go. I highly recommend the Four Cheese. I tried both Four Cheese and NY Cheese. NY was a little saltier and had red sauce, the four cheese was creamy and chewy.

Walk right up and order but be sure to say For Here. Busy hours call ahead and pick up to-go.
author: Hannah S.

description:
On our tour of North Beach, we decided to hop off on Washington Square (Little Italy) and find some good eats. I was craving pizza & this spot caught our eye... There's a booth in the inside & some tables out front, it being a beautiful day we decided to eat out front.

Soon as you walk in the smell of bomb pizza hits you like a ton of bricks. There were a few pies on display, we ended up going with the Sicilian Combo ($6/per slice) & a Calzone ($8). 

The pizza was definitely 5 Stars, in hindsight one of those slices was enough to get me comfortably satisfied. Fresh toppings, flavorful sauce & Crispy crust. I could've did without the Calzone, all the meat ended up on one side & it was a bit too oily for my liking.

Customer service was okay, the young lady that helped us wasn't rude or friendly. They seemed pretty busy in the kitchen & they might've had some suits in the back, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt for not making us feel welcomed. Didn't see if they had a restroom or not.

Pizza - 5 
Atmosphere - 5 
Calzone - 3 
Customer Service - 3
author: Raul E.

description:
Personally, I've always been interested in places that serve pizza with potato as a topping. Really don't see those often so it's a rare treat when I do get to have pizza with potato as a topping. This place is actually right next to Tony's Pizza, which is probably the bigger sitdown area next to this place for those who want to sit and relax while they enjoy their pizza. Anyways, I came here on a weekend and got two slices of their purple potato pizza to-go. It may be a coincidence, but when I got there, I had to wait for the purple potato pizza and had to wait for it to bake, perhaps a testament to its popularity compared to their other offerings.

Each slice is pretty large and topped generously with plenty of bacon. There's a couple of giant purple potato slices on top, slathered with pesto, which paired well together. It's also pretty oily, due to the bacon, which only made it more delicious. The crust is pretty good and crunchy and sprinkled with abundant herbs. The above is made even more delicious due to the fact that the pizza was piping hot when I ate it. After I finished, I was pretty satiated and left feeling pretty full.

In my opinion, $5.50 is a lot for a slice of pizza, but since they're larger than a normal slice of pizza, I think it's a lot more reasonable after taking that into account. It also helped that I got really full of those two slices. I look forward to coming back here again, and I saw a calzone on the counter, and I think I could see myself getting that next time if I'm not in the mood for the purple potato pizza. All in all, for those looking for a quick bite, I would highly recommend this to anyone who is craving pizza.
author: Nelson X.

description: I don't like pizza, but this place was so pretty good quality. I love how it's crispy the crust is!
author: Kiana S.

description: The vibe here is amazing. The pizza is also AMAZINg. We all got slices of pizza to-go that were the size of our faces, and went to the park that is a 30 second walk away  to eat our pizza and watch cute dogs play in the grass ( irrelevant, but also, RELEVANT. ) I got a slice of cheese and it was pricey I guess ( 5 dollars ) but in the end it was really filling so it was worth it.
author: Nieku B.

description: Being raised around the east coast and arguably the worlds best pizza...  me uttering the worlds "best slice I've had not on the east coast" was bold words... yes I realize the pizza is the same as next door if you order that style- the vibe of a counter, pulling a slice, hearing it up and dishing it out was on point! If the pizza they have doesn't peak your interest, don't be afraid to ask as they might have something else behind the counter. If you want a good, east coast style, slice of pie... I highly recommend this place!
author: Patrick A.

description: This is the best pizza in SF!!!! You must must must try it. Pepperoni is my favorite.
author: Kellynrubí -.

description:
In North Beach and needed a quick dinner before a show.  I thought about Tony's, the other infamous pizza in the area, since I tried the other well-known Golden Boy.  Tony's has it sit-down restaurant at the corner and its pizza take out by the pie or slice is couple of storefronts up on Stockton St. 

They offer five pizzas by the slice, Pepperoni. California Veggie, NY Cheese, Meat Lover's and 4 Cheese and a Sicilian Combo calzone. There are other choices by the whole pie. Checking out the pizzas, I went with the Meat Lover's.  It's a large slice with a crust that has the right crisp to it. Not crispy like a flatbread pizza. It had a perfect combination of tomato sauce, melted cheese, bacon, salami, pepperoni slices and pieces of tasty sausage. Some pizzas are greasy, but there was no grease at all here. It was so good, that I had to order another one. 

The shop has one table that sits four, but there is a table in front and tables at their curb area. It was a little drizzly on this day, which made the outdoor tables not useable.  Luckily I was able to sit in the inside table to enjoy my pizza. 

Delicious NY style pizza at Tony's, which offers a different option to the Neapolitan style offered at the other infamous place around the corner. Friendly service but due to its limited indoor seating compared to the other place has me stopping short on an overall 5 star rating.
author: Al L.

description:
I got 16 NY pizzas, 1 coal tomato pie cheese, 1 quinoa salad catered from here. 

They told me that I'd get 10% off. 

The pizzas did not come out the way they normally come out when you go to the restaurant. They were extremely dry with congealed cheese.

On top of that, they didn't give me 10% off. 

We picked up and tipped them $60 even though it wasn't great.

And then WHEN I CHECKED MY CREDIT CARD they ended up billing us $20 more than they were supposed to. So someone altered the tip to be higher.

Absolute fraud.

Do not cater from here.

If you ever go here, please, please check your bill and count everything. And check your credit card statement after.

Cheaters cheaters cheaters.
author: Pavan K.

description:
If you want good pizza and you're in a hurry, look no further than Tony's coal fired pizza.  This is the same famous Tony's pizza as next door, only you have fewer options to choose from (from a topping and 'style' standpoint.)  This spot is fast and easy, though it can be swarming with tourists who don't want to wait for a table at the restaurant next door, so watch out.  I had the pepperoni (traditional NY slice) and the Sicilian combo (square slice) and both were fantastic.  Each slice is about $5+ and the service is good but not great (the activity can be pretty fast paced behind the counter.)  Also, there's plenty of outdoor seating just outside of the store, or you can hop over the park across the street.

Overall, this is the way to go if you're craving a quality slice of pizza.
author: Tom G.

description:
This place saves relationships! The oldman has a thing for slices - thin NY-style slices. He has a hankering for slices too frequently. Luckily, this place also has the ever elusive Italian Beef sandwiches that I've been lusting for since our visit to Chicago a few years back. 

I have only tried the pizza once or twice - usually just a bite off the oldman's slice, and it's always pretty darn tasty. But, I LOVE and think about their Italian Beef sandwiches regularly. I usually order the Cheef - includes cheese. This place does break my heart occasionally when they run out of Italian Beefs. WHY? Apparently, they get the beef for these heavenly sandwiches from Capo's, down the street (which only used to serve them at lunch, but now serve at lunch and dinner - you're welcome). So, if your hungry little heart is on the quest for this sandwich, you'll need to get there earlier in the day to score. 

In addition to pizza by the slice, they also offer whole pies, and some thick Chicago style too. But my heart belongs to the Cheef!
author: Kara B.

description: Best calzone I ever had. Amazing fluffy crust and exceptional filling. A truly delectable treat. Awesome!!
author: Tom P.

description:
"REALLY BIG Slice of Pizza!" 
That's probably what you'll think when you get your slice of pizza. The price of around $6 - $7 for pizza was kind of too steep in my opinion, but one slice is probably all you'll need to get you relatively full. 

I ordered the veggie pizza and the meat lover's and I thought the crust was nice. It was super crunchy and it was able to support a large amount of toppings. The ingredients tasted fresh, but I think the pepperoni & cheese was too greasy. 

Random stuff:
- The female cashier who took my order, Shauntel was friendly.
- There's limited seating inside, but there's a bunch of seats outside.
author: Victor L.

description:
I'm not sure how I feel about Slice House because it's the same people that brought you Tony's next door but it just doesn't quite have the same pizzazz to it. Come here if you want to grab a quick slice on the go but don't want to wait upwards of 2 hours next door for the real deal.

Slice House is the lesser of the two. It's just not the same. Maybe because you're not sitting in the famous Tony's sit-down seating or maybe the lack of a wait makes it less tasty?

It's good for what it is: a quick slice on the go but it doesn't come cheap. If you get their meatier options it can run up to $6-$7 a slice which isn't worth it in my opinion. The selection is much smaller than the actual restaurant.

I don't know why it's not the same quality but maybe they churn out more pies here for quick demand. The crust is always off here. Either too chewy or too dry and the toppings can get overly greasy. 

I'd rather endure the wait and eat the real deal. Plus you've got gorgeous Washington Sq. Park nearby to hang out in until your number is called -- literally they text you when the table is ready.
author: Connie M.

description:
This is a review for the pizza by the slice take out which is adjacent to the restaurant.  Fantastic huge slices of pizza by the slice, approx. $5.50 a slice.

5 stars You can order anything on the restaurant menu from here without the wait (the restaurant wait was 1 1/2 hours when we visited). We were able to snag one of three tables outside and dine alfresco, there is also one booth inside.

The menu can be a bit confusing for first timers like us.  They make three different types of pizza crust cooked in three different ovens, coal, gas and wood.  Certain pizzas cooked in certain ovens have certain toppings and flavor combinations. Trust me and if ordering from here versus the restaurant, just grab some pizza by the slice which is made in the 525 degree Rotoflex glass oven.  The pizza is hot, fresh and tasty and tasted way better than the one we waited 25 minutes for which was cooked in the wood fired oven:

2 stars $23 Skip the wood fired Margherita pizza they are famous for (they only make 73 per day) when ordering from take out, it gets soggy and watery, and tasted almost sour/bitter from being burned and charred.  I was not a fan and was told later by several employees that the wood fired Margherita pizza is only good when dining in the restaurant. The slices behind the glass which are hot and ready to go, or whole pies not made in the wood fired oven are much better from take out.

5 stars Slices of Veggie pizza with tons of fresh veggies, sauce was not salty or overpowering, crust was light, a pleasure to eat, we all loved it.

5 stars Slices 4 cheese, also very decadent, rich and tasty

5 stars Little Italy Salad $12 with chopped castelveltrano olives, shaved parmesan, walnuts, imported gorgonzola, cherry tomatoes and a great balsamic, fresh greens, large enough to share with 3-4 people for a side salad serving.

Loved our new SF discovery!  Will be back!  Don't forget to stop at Stella's pastry shop just a few blocks away-walking distance-for a Cannoli, slice of Tiramisu or Italian cookies and an espresso for dessert!
author: Dawn F.

description:
This is the to-go extension to the sit-down version of Tony's Pizza Napoletana which is next door. Tony's Pizza has been on the "Best Pizza in America" list and has won a lot of pizza awards making it on the must visit list of people visiting SF. This has resulted in long wait times at Tony's (minimum 1 hour plus for a table) positioning the Slice house as a convenient place to get a slice to-go quickly.

Actually Tony's is so popular that even the Slice house which has a couple of seats inside and outside ends up being full with a line out of the door. I've passed by a couple of times but have skipped it as the line has been way too long for my comfort. A couple of days ago around lunch time there was no line so I went in. It seems that the slice house is "what you see is what you get", meaning you can select from whatever pizza they have in the display case on the counter, take it or leave it. Unfortunately when I went all that they had in the case was some Stromboli, Calzones, Cheese pizza and Peperoni pizza. Looking at the small selection I decided to get their Calzone ($8) to-go (+55c for to-go box).

As the calzone was already precooked, it was heated up and I was on my way. It seemed that they had brushed the calzone with some sort of oil to give it a fresh feel, all of which stuck to the to-go box leaving the calzone dry as a bone. The calzone seemed to be decent sized, but it was just a hollow pocket of thick bread. There was hardly any filling inside. The two tiny containers of marinara sauce that came with the calzone tasted like plain crushed tomatoes. Overall this was probably one of the worst calzones that I've had. Only the hollow center was edible. The sides were state bread fit for the dustbin, so that's where they ended up. At $6+ per slice this had to be one of the most expensive to-go pizza places in the area (where rates range from $3.75 - $5).

This is a Tourist Trap. They are cashing in on their popularity by charging premium prices for average stuff. The 55c for the to-go box is testament to how confident they are of maintaining their prices. My recommendation would be that while visiting SF, if you need to scratch the itch of checking Tony's off your list, go to the sit down version. At-lease over there after waiting for an hour you will get to order a pizza of your choice rather than being forced to buy super expensive slices of what's available. I on the other hand have no intention of returning.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
Bad policy about no more to go boxes for pizza slices.  Used to always pay additional for boxes. What gives? Major inconvenience!!! Carrying hot pizza is not my idea of fun. By the time I got to my destination, the grease soaked through and dripped onto my shirt.

Until management comes up with a more rational approach for customers to transport their hot slices minus the grease,I'll be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Excellent pizza. Very large slices. Not a ton of selection but perfect quick grab and go meal. Very good ingredients and fresh taste.
author: Garrick P.

description:
Italian Beef Sandwich at 4 in the afternoon sounded like a delicious idea. I've been coming to Tony's slice house on 2nd, at the ballpark, and Tony's Pizza Napoletana since they've opened. For the last 3 years or so I've been coming to Tony's Coal Fired for the beef sandwiches as they've been good and with gravy that's been delicious. Last night it was such a failure I need to let people know since the manager there didn't seem to take much interest in my complaint. 
Ordered original wet Italian Beef and one with sausage, but no sausage at 4pm. Ok then, two originals please. The gravy was just beef fat, not the salty flavor filled liquid I wanted. Again, greasy flavorless congealing fat. Brought back sandwich and was shown and told that is how they've made. They even poured some into a container for me. 3/4 fat 1/4 gravy. They offered to make another sandwich but why would I want the same greasy pile. So I asked for the cup of gravy, showed my friend, whose comment on how gross that was isn't postable, and poured off the grease and watched it harden as it hit the cold San Francisco air. Yuck. Poured tiny bit of gravy on remaining sandwich. 
Tony G, I hope you read this. Please smack anyone who sullies a potentially great sandwich and thinks a 1/4 cup of beef grease is a scoop of gravy. Gravy is gravy. Greasy mucilaginous congealng beef fat laden sandwiches are gross. Juicy wet beefy sandwiches are a slice of heaven.
author: Ron G.

description:
My son and I were looking for a slice walked all over and then decided on Tony's. Price seemed right & we heard in the crowd people saying how good it was! He got a slice of pepperoni I got the Stromboli. So good!!! Both!! Sat at the park and enjoyed exactly what we were looking for. 
Best part: Sauce in the pepperoni & the garlic Parmesan seasoning on the crust of the Stromboli!!! 
Lost a star for not enough seating.
author: Francine L.

description:
I'm nuts about Tony and Tony's pizza. He's very kind and incredibly talented and his pizza is THE BEST. Ingredients are high quality like you won't find in other places. However, this doesn't translate to the slice house. We had the four cheese and meat lovers. The cheese was thin and hard, like even the heating didn't soften it up and ricotta was cold. The meat lovers toppings were good but the pizza isn't warm enough to get any cheese melty and the crust on both pizza was not good, overly gritty. Like sandpaper on the outside. Nothing like the pizzas from his restaurant, which is where we normally go.

What saved our trip was we had the opportunity to meet Tony! He's very nice, just like on his YouTube videos.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Damn. I don't know if it's because I'm pregnant and was CRAVING pizza,  ANY pizza, salty, cheesy, greasy, spicy pepperoni PIZZA, but Tony's. Hit. The. SPOT! Humongous slice, tons of pepp, crispy not too thin, not too thick dough, piping hot, perfect amount of grease, YASSSS. 
Baby happy, me happy, let me happily waddle my behind home now.
author: Natasha C.

description:
$5.50 for a mediocre slice of vegetarian pizza.  With just 1 other person in front of me, I still had to wait 15m for it.  

The one saving grace: plenty of outside seating, so my dog could join me.
author: George K.

description: The pizza is good, but not worth the hours of wait. Stephanie wasn't our server but was really great. Our server... he didn't really stay long enough for us to get to know him. He would be walking past us and shout at us as to whether we were doing okay without breaking stride. With so many great pizza places in the city, a bit confused why this place commands such a long wait.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Hungry for Pizza and don't want to wait 1 hour + to get seated at Tony's Restaurant? Well, the next door slice version is your best chance!

Bummed out we couldn't have beer [boo hoo :'( ] we were able to get a free table for 4 on a 2pm Saturday memorial weekend. Can you get luckier than this? Don't think so! It did start to get more crowded as we were finishing our meal but there is a park nearby where you can eat your pizza if you can't get a spot here tho.

Pizza is oily and delicious! Between the 4 of us we shared 2 slices of Margarita, Pepperoni, NY and 1 slice of Sicilian (which had everything in it! Everything was heavenly. Their pizza dough is different, bread-y and delicious and it will get the job done to get you full. 

Again, bummed out about no beer but come prepared if that's a deal breaker for you and get your own beer from a liqueur store nearby. HA!

Pizza! Ti amo tanto! Non ti lasciero Mai! (Pizza I love you lots and will never leave you)
author: Heliana M.

description:
This is so sad that my very first review on yelp has to go to Tony's pizza....I spent over $6 on a slice of pizza that legit had nothing to it. It was burnt SO crispy that there was no pizza to it. I should've just bought a bag of Doritos. 

The cashier with the red hair also majorly needs an attitude check. She was rude and had disagreements with 3 customers who were just trying to pick up orders. smh.....

I can't believe I drove all the way from Daly City to try their pizza for the first time.. worst slice I've ever had in my entire life.
author: Susan L.

description: Overly hyped is my opinion. It was a long wait and the pizza didn't quite live up to my expectations especially since this place is known as "best pizza in sf". I ordered a pepperoni slice and it was big which I liked but the pepperonis were kinda burnt and just didn't leave a good taste in my mouth. I don't think I would visit this place again, would probably try a different place since there's so many in San Francisco.
author: Hadeel A.

description: Loved it!  I was in town visiting, and had to stop here.  I was a little shocked at the prices, but the size of the slice was well worth it.  I was here on a Saturday night, so it was busy, nowhere to sit, and the pizzeria was full, but across the street is a park which made a perfect spot to sit on a bench and eat the pizza.
author: Jason T.

description: Came for the 4 cheese pizza for two slices and was told it would be 10 minutes. 35-40 minutes later they still hadn't given us our slices. At that point we no longer had time to eat it there so we took it go. The slices are large and each slice was 5.50. The four cheese had quarter sized mounds of ricotta cheese along with the other blend. It was greasy but overall was good tasting. But overpriced and clearly a wait so if in a rush would not count on the pizza slices as being fast
author: E T.

description: I was so excited to go to this place and maybe I just chose the wrong night or maybe I should eat at the restaurant instead but my experience was very unpleasant. First, the woman who took my order was definitely very unhappy to be there. But I thought it's fine, I feel her, at least the pizza will be good. But then I got my pizza and prior to getting it I asked them to make the bottom really crispy to avoid exactly what happened. I grabbed my first slice and it was so soggy. the bottom of the pizza was basically wet. I would go home and just put it in the toaster oven no problem but I couldn't do that because it was just wet. Pretty bummed since i've been so stoked to try this place.
author: Alexa P.

description: I usually don't subtract this many stars for service, but I was very disappointed in this slice house. We ordered two slices of pizza and an Italian beef sandwich to go. We received our two slices of pizza and patiently waited for our beef sandwich. We decided to eat our pizza (even though we paid 0.25 cents for the box) and inquired about the beef sandwich, but found out it was never fired in the kitchen. We waited for at least 30 minutes total (40 numbers called in between) until they finally completed our order. We were not offered any compensation for our time wasted at this place other than a bottled drink. The pizza was really greasy and pretty soggy.  The Italian beef sandwich was extremely salty. We've been to other locations of Tony's and have had much better food and service than this.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I'm a fan of Tony's pizza. Tony's pizza slice is pretty huge. Although the bottom part is thin, the cheese and meat is really good after being ovened. The cheese and pepperoni was the best part. Price? Not the best. Could be better. 

-1 star because the slice I got was really really salty. 

Overall, I would come back if I am in the neighborhood.

Update: The manager contacted me regarding the salt level on the pizza. I really appreciate you contacting customers regarding their issues. +1 star for commutations. Thank you!
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
The pizza is good but that doesn't make it ok for the staff and the manager to treat their customers with contempt. 

It's clear that when Tony's Slice House gets busy and when you order a whole pizza, they will take your pizza cut it up in slices so they can serve the clients buying slices before you. Of course, they do not tell you this and you end up waiting double the amount of time they quoted you initially. 

This has happened on numerous occasions and their response is either,  "it will be right out" or "it's the next one out." This past Saturday it happened, I was order number 497, when I arrived 30 minutes after I called the order in, they were already calling numbers in the 530's. I was told it would be a few minutes and I ended up waiting another 30 minutes in their store. There was a guy waiting for his order number which was around 450. We both asked to speak to a manager who did nothing but offer empty apologies and disdain for our frustration. She failed to realize that proper expectation setting with clients could have avoided our frustration. The two women working the registers were some of the rudest people I've encountered. 

Some advice: 
1. Avoid this place on the weekends 
2. Or try North Beach Pizza, which is right around the corner. The pizza is a little bit doughier but it's good and the team is at least plesant to deal with.
author: Charles R.

description:
I would have to recommend against going here and using any sort of payment method besides cash, and even then I would advise you against giving this company and these owners your business. 

At the advice of a friend who found multiple fraudulent charges on his credit card statement, I checked mine and found 6. 5 of which I was out of the city for, and one I was at a dinner at a separate restaurant on the opposite side of the city. 

Definitely reconsider whether or not a greasy slice of pizza is worth the hassle of having to get a new credit card, and whether or not this ownership deserves the business in the first place.
author: Adam W.

description:
The folks who work here are friendly, efficient, and on top of things, but other than that I didn't find anything special about the pizza, other than the fact that the slices were reasonably large and filling, with reasonably hefty prices to match. 

Depending on what they have here at a given time, most anything is going to be decently satisfying, whether a slice of meat lovers' or a helping of veggie. If it isn't terribly crowded, snagging a seat outside is a nice way to grab a quick, casual bite if it isn't too cold out, and if you don't feel like waiting at more crowded places elsewhere in the neighborhood. Overall, a thoroughly decent, if slightly spendy place given what you get.
author: Vincent L.

description: For the pizza lovers A San Francisco must foodie alert this is a very poplar pizza spot in north beach when we arrived the line was out the door but well worth the wait pizza wasn't greasy had a great flavor and the slices are huge I will definitely be back!
author: Sac M.

description: I've been looking to going to Tony's for a while. I was a little disappointed because the only pizza that is coal fired is the whole pizza. If you get a slice of pizza it is not coal fire pizza. That being said the slice of pizza was pretty damn good.. I got a slice of cheese pizza first and it was so good that I went back got sliced pepperoni. It took about five minutes to get each slice. The crust was flaky which is delicious and it almost is like it was woodfired.
author: Brett H.

description:
The West Coast isn't particularly known for a particularly strong pizza game, but this place is probably one of the best spots that I've been to in California. This spot is the takeout version of Tony's main restaurant right next door. Since it can be an extremely long wait to get a seat at the main restaurant, this place is a great alternative if you're looking to get the same pizza without the lines.

Just so you know - only the pizzas that are on display are available for grab and go. I ordered the New Yorker and we had to wait around 20-30 minutes before our pizza was ready. It was still shorter than what it would've been if we were waiting at the main restaurant, but it would've been nice to have been aware of this before we picked that pizza.

Seating is nonexistent. You'll probably be standing outside the restaurant or at the one table right outside, but it's not bad as this place is often well trafficked and it's pretty socially acceptable to just stand outside. Check this place out if you're looking for good pizza and one that you can order quickly.
author: Josh C.

description: This place is great for the food but the reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because our waitress Michaela let's just say she had a really bad attitude. I understand its busy and believe me I work with customers all day I know how customers can be but her attitude was really ugly. She never smiled and she was such in a hurry. She took forever with everything. The food was amazing but she killed my vibe while I was there.
author: Elia M.

description:
Lordy! This was some delicious pizza! Originating from New York, oftentimes it's difficult to find a good slice when I'm most craving one. Tony's Coal-Fired DEFINITELY itched that scratch for me. The dough, the sauce, the cheese - perfection! The $5 price tag was well worth it since the slice could have easily made 2 or 3.

Interestingly enough, the sign outside the door says "Italian ices" yet they do not sell any. The nice cashier suggested a place around the corner which, although sold sorbet, did not disappoint. It was kind of him to recommend.

Needless-to-say, the service (especially for a busy counter service atmosphere) was on point and the pizza was to DIE for! We will be back. Thanks, Tony's!
author: Danielle P.

description: Yeah! you will miss this place if  you don't know its there! Reason being you will go to the main Tony's pizza. So how does it get 5 stars? As a pizza connoisseur , I have tried pizza in many places all over the US. My standard is NY/NJ East Coast Pizza. They get it right there. To find the same pizza elsewhere is a real challenge. Indeed some parts of the country it is impossible! In San Francisco there are many that claim to make NY Pizza, but often come up short. The crust is not flexible, it's too thick. The sauce is not enough or to much, does not fold. Having said that Tony's Slice House nails it! a pure slice of heaven. And even when the re-heat it there is no loss in flavor and texture.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
After happy hour had us fairly happy we set out to grab dinner.  I had been meaning to check out the famous Tony's pizza but unfortunately the wait was over an hour for 2 people so we decided to pop in the slice hut next door and see what was cookin.   

This place has a large community table inside and a few seats outside.  They had about 4-5 different pies they were selling by the slice.  I got a slice of "picante" and my fiancé got a slice of the "California veggie". We were eating witching 2 minutes and although it's not the full Tony's experience we were pretty satisfied with our pizzas.  

After Tony's we called it a night and got an uber home.  Good way to end a day with lots of food, walking, drink, and of course good company.
author: Dan O.

description: Recommended from a relative who lives in SF...  I appreciate the fresh mozzarella and sauce although $31 for a small margarita pizza is quite pricey.  The pie was not cooked well kinda soggy for my taste...
author: Surf City M.

description:
We were here last night, on a Sunday at about 10pm, where the line was out the door. It was about 100 degrees inside, people were all over the place, and they were literally running out of pizza. I settled with pepperoni slices, six of the to be exact. 

Waited about 45 minutes for them to come out with them, where two girls drunk out of their minds comes and takes every single slice.. six slices to be exact. They literally asked why either one of them ordered so much pizza. They didn't even know what they ordered. 

I told the dude at the cashier...like wtf, what they even order? He honestly told me, "you know what bro, I didn't even take their order, I wouldn't know". We talked for two seconds about how ridiculously they were acting. he apologized for them doing so, and gave me a full refund, even though it wasn't *technically* his fault these two chicks took the pizza. 

His exact words were, "hey man, I didn't want you to stand there and wait for nothing", and he handed me two slices of four-cheese pizza on the house. 

Holy. 
Balls. 

Literally the best pizza I've EVER had in my entire life. Cheese was melty, the ricotta was creamy and quality, and it was delicious. There was barely any sauce, if any, which is how I want my pizza. I couldn't get over the fact that the crust rated almost as if it were deep fried. Everything about it was great. 



Fast forward to today, Monday September 4th, and we ordered when there was actually pizza available to order. I had to come back. First impressions are everything and I was genuinely impressed. 

We ordered the New Yorker, piled with cheeses, spicy sausage and pepperoni, and had a whole pizza in this instance. 

The ingredients were top notch. The sausage was great, and the same cheesy quality it had before was there again. There was a bunch of sauce on it, which I assumed it wasn't going to have a lot, but I'm not gonna complain. 

But Jesus Christ. I'm very picky with my food, and pizza especially. I've never REALLY found a place that I liked, but this place changed everything. I will be back, and always will visit this place at least once whenever I'm back in SF.
author: Calvin C.

description:
Forgot to make a reservation for the restaurant and didn't want to wait in line..thank goodness for the Slice House!

I ordered a whole pizza instead of getting the slice. Glad I did that cos they didn't have 'The New Yorker" by slice and only while pizza. This is one of the best pizza I've ever had! Perfect flavor plus perfect crust! Salivating as I write this...
author: Jive O.

description: EEK i love this place!! and i will never go to another pizza place!! Casual slice house, fast and convenient! Always hot slices and decent pricing!! Parking is hard to find but definitely worth it!!
author: Alyssa J.

description:
OH man - I went here on a weekday and split the Italian beef sandwich with Cheese (the Chief)

It was amazing!!! - one of the top 10 sammy's in SF.
author: Amy W.

description: I went to Tony's (sit down restaurant) for the first time recently and thought their margherita pizza was amazing and definitely lived up to the hype. Today, I went to the slice house hoping to get some of the same, delicious pizza and was severely disappointed. The cheese on the pizza was rubbery and the sauce tasted completely different. I didn't even finish the slice and will not be back. I'm not sure if I'm mistaken in thinking that the slice house should have pizzas that taste just like the sit-down restaurant next door, but that's what I was expecting and it's just not the same.
author: K P.

description: If you don't want to wait for 2 hours for Tony's dining then definitely do to this to go Tony's location. It's right next to it and is literally the best pizza you'll have in California. I would give it a five stars if they'd have a little bit more table and chairs outside but taste wise it's amazing. Definitely a must try place.
author: Sumbal A.

description:
Thought I was going t get one of those overhyped tourist traps as I walked up to Tony's...... "Named best Pizza by the IPF (International Pizza Foundation ) is that even possible?????

I've been to Bianco's, Mozza, Difaras, Grimaldi's and both those places in Nee Haven.... and all the other legendary pizza places... tasted some great Pies... Tony's seemed like it was trying to makem all deepdish, coalfired, thickcrust, thin crust coal fired, electric for goodness sake.... you name they do it!!!! You can't be good at everything.

Gonna say it.... the coal fired New Yorker at Tony's was as good as any I've ever tasted.  Sauce can be a deal breaker for me... Tony's is perfect combo of sweet, tang and viscosity .  The natural casing pepperonis curled and crisped just right, the calabrese sausage had that late kick that makes you go oooh! The small dollops of ricotta were an interesting addition, perfect.  The crust had those awesome blistered bubbles and a balance between crispy and chewy that's as rare as the "chupcabra".


Place is righteous ! Food is phenomenal just overtook Roli Roti on my must have San Francisco Treat!
author: Mark W.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I have had just about all kinds of pizza there is. 
I love pizza - I live for pizza. I am a pizza WHORE. 
Tony's has the best pizza I've ever had in California. 
The margherita by the slice in particular. My God. I dream of this pizza. My boyfriend and I had it 3 times in our short weekend visit to San Fransisco. 
Two days in a row, twice the second day and one to take with us- it's that good. 

You can order by the slice or you can order a whole pizza. I will say that for some odd reason ordering margherita by the slice tastes ten times better. The whole pizza was still out of this world but I think the by the slice is different in some way. 

IF YOU HAVEN'T BEEN HERE. WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? 
Grab a slice or ten and eat while you people watch at the park across the street
author: Jennifer G.

description: Very cool place in Little Italy in San Fran.  It has all the looks of a very local style pizza joint.  The seating is mostly outdoors which is nice because usually the weather is fair in SF.  The pizza was ok, thus the lack of 1 star.  I'm pretty picky on my pizza and this didn't really wow me.  I did like that they used the small pepperonis that curl up around the edges when baked.  There was a line but don't let it worry you, they are very fast at getting people through the line.
author: Cash S.

description:
Never again! Never again! NEVER AGAIN! 
The pizza is decent but the service sucks! 

I get it, ok...you're upset that you're working at a pizzeria and bitter that you have to take orders from Joe Q Public, but if you don't like it and it's beneath you to work there, then quit already. Just ring me up and give me my slice Bro! No drama please! (And $6 for a slice? Ummmm, Tony's ain't all that.) 
The attitude from these clowns is off the charts! After 6 years, I'm officially done with Tony's. This is SF...food galore everywhere! Bye Felicia!
author: Herbert C.

description:
If you're looking for a place that does really tasty large slices in a range of toppings, this is a great place to stop in for a quick lunch or dinner. There's very little seating inside so be prepared to grab a seat outdoors at the tables on the sidewalk. 

Prices are decent for the area (North Beach so expect them to be a bit more than the typical slice place) but the slices are large enough to make it worth it.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I've a special review
I've been saving for years
For a place just like this
With cold food and warm tears
This place is atrocious and horrid and dull
The service will make you drill holes in your skull
It's really the Worst of the Worst of the Year
Its tiny and hot and loud on your ear.
I say it's the work of an infantile mind
I say that it's terrible, and that you will find
A better excuse to spend money or time
At a Tupper-Ware Party
So, do be a smarty!
Hold on to that dollar
A little while longer
For spending it here
Why, it couldn't be wronger!

The pizza's ok but the staff is from hell
They don't care a whit and they'll be happy to tell
You that your pizza order, it didn't go in
Can you wait another hour, they'll say with a grin
Can't have your money back, its in the vault
and keep your mouth shut, its probably your fault

I spoke to the manager, he kicked me out
I used some bad words but I didn't shout
I felt like fisticuffs, but thats not my way
Hence the review your reading today.
And after this deadly review hits the net
I hope that this might make them sweat
Because I want to legally execute all that remains
Of this tragic Slice House with drug-addled brains

Of course I know it won't matter a bit,
The people that work there, they don't give a sh*t.
But if your reading this before that you go...
Right up the street is Golden Boy, they're pizza is great
Very nice people, rarely a wait.

Good Luck and have a great time in S.F.
author: Paul H.

description:
Back in February my wife and I went to Pizza Rock (also owned by Tony Gemignani) in Las Vegas for my 50th birthday.  At that time we ordered a Neapolitan margarita and one of their "classic Italian" pizzas, both of which were very bland and disappointing.  On the way out I noticed their takeout/slice window and those pizzas looked better than what we were served in the restaurant.  With that in mind, I looked forward to having a Gemignani slice from his flagship operation in san Francisco.  

Unfortunately, the slices were utterly unremarkable.  It didn't cross the line into "bad" pizza but it's not an "elite" pizzeria.  Don't believe all the marketing hype.
author: Jonas A.

description:
Have you ever wondered where is the best pizza in the world? Well you've hit the right yelp review. There is honestly no other better pizza place in the whole world. Their thin crust pizza is topped with delicious tomato sauce, covered in rich cheeses and other glorious meats and veggies and is drizzled with a little extra virgin olive oil and is essentially baked to heavenly perfection!

Right next door is Tony's Pizza Napoletana but their wait time usually ranges from about 1-2 hours but Slice House is their "to-go" version of the fancy sit down restaurant. Plus their location in the city is great too. Right across from Slice House is Washington Square Park and you can easily find lots of parking spots near the restaurant which can be pretty hard to find in San Francisco. For 5 dollars a slice you honestly can't go wrong!
author: Millie B.

description:
After my "hike" up to Coit tower, this was the perfect "treat." Why the quotations? Cuz calling the walk up to Coit tower a hike is a complete and utter joke and I don't need, never ever need an excuse to eat ;p

Best NY style pizza on the west coast I've had thus far. Just walk up, order, and wait for your slice to be reheated. That wait was torture. The smells coming from those ovens were heavenly. I believe I got what was called the NY meat lovers(?) and it was almost a perfect NY pizza! A bit thicker than the real counterpart, but delicious nonetheless. 

They have one table inside and plenty of outdoor seating. It was a beautiful day with a cool breeze, my slice and me :D
author: Grace C.

description: Great pizza by the slice. Warm and friendly service. Cut slices to order. Chewy crust and great place to stop at and not spend allot of money.
author: P G.

description: I've had pizza from their 2nd street location and I was generally impressed.. but this one last night was bad. The $6-per-slice ripoff of a pizza here tasted like microwaved two-day-old pizza, with a bland, stale, chewy (in a bad way) crust that reminded me of cardboard. Pass...
author: Kazu O.

description: Best pizza I've ever had.  One inside table and four outside tables.  The pizza crust is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Soooo goood!
author: Aimee E.

description: Pizza is great but I've tried calling literally 10 times and left a message to no avail so I'm amending my review to three stars for horrible service.  Alas, service is super important so I'll no longer give my business, my businesses business or advocacy for Tony's.
author: Bryan G.

description:
Do you like to be treated like garbage? One of the girls taking the order got a bunch of people's orders wrong including mine, she never apologized, she would just sort of walk away from people, smirk, overall a really bad attitude. When I got my wrong order, they gave me a box of meatballs instead of a meatball sub,  I brought it back to her and said: hey I ordered a meatball sub, she said "we don't have that". At that point I just flagged someone else and said I had ordered the sub.

While I was waiting and this is what was shocking to me, the other cashier started to yell at an Uber driver waiting for a food pick up. He was waiting by the door for the longest time. He went up to ask her about the time because they were already 4 minutes behind on the estimated time and she started shouting at him that she would just cancel the order if he asked again, then she told him: you go wait by door, get away from me and go wait by the door. Then she started saying: tranquilo tranquilo in bad Spanish to him because she assumed he was Hispanic because of his skin color, the guy was not Hispanic and looked at her like: what the hell are you saying? I've never seen someone treat another human being so poorly for no reason. She treated that guy like he was not deserving of any respect. It was disgusting. The whole energy at the place is awful and negative. Just bad people doing a bad job. If you want your food served with a dash of hatred then come here, if you want to be treated with the tiniest shred of human decency then this is not the place for that.
author: Raquel G.

description: I love the NY coal fired pizza so much I make excuses to go to N. Beach just so I can get a pie or two.  The Margherita pizza is also quite good.
author: Joe J.

description: ***Review for the slice house*** I've been to this place 50 times in the past 6 months. It was really good originally, but over the past few months the quality has dropped exponentially. The slices are almost unbearable now. And I am not being dramatic, it is literally just gross. The customer service is equally terrible. $28 for 4 slices of pizza that taste just as good as Pizza Hut. Today was the last time I will ever go back to this place. Avoid at all costs.
author: Josh C.

description:
I haven't been here in a while but was in the area today. I got a couple of cheese pizza slices - it was the right amount of cheese and crispy crust - perfection! After my first bite, I realized I should visit North Beach more often!  

Love their restaurant next door but the wait can be crazy so if you're in a rush, I recommend grabbing a couple of slices from here - you'll make your belly happy immediately :)
author: Kalani K.

description:
#NationalPizzaDay2016 - I won't lie, I didn't eat here this day because I had a craving for another spot.  But, I couldn't resist the fun of posting a review of one of the top spots in SF for pizza.

If you know the pizza scene in SF, you know that Tony Gemignani is basically the wunderkind of authentic NY style pizza.   If you are looking for a great place to try higher end Tony's pizza without having to go to a sit down spot, you're in luck.  Simply put, great for what it is.   I'm excited to write the following as it is still National Pizza Day on February 9th, 2016.

The dough is cooked to a perfect place in relation to the sauce, cheese and great ingredients. This is what truly great NY pizza is.  It's about the crispy and flavorful dough, with sauce and cheese that are integrated rather than floating on top.  It's about perfection in the balance of ingredients, water and heat.  This is it.  Maybe not the best pizza ever, but a true representation of the style.  They have a good range of options - and yeah, you can get other types of slices like Sicilian or Detroit.  You are probably best served to try the classic NY cheese slice.  Go from there.

I fell in love with Golden Boy Pizza first when I came to SF.  I've subsequently gone on to fall in love with some other really good stuff.  Tony's can be very good, and I rate it a tie as my favorite spot to get a slice in North Beach.  The lines can be daunting if you come at the wrong time.  And they won't tolerate nonsense, they don't need you.  They're well-known, so don't sound off about the line moving slower than it should.  If you're savvy enough to be here, you probably get it.  Take it in.  They have tremendous pizza in the garden spot of SF to eat a great piece of pizza.  I shared a few pictures that I hope illustrate it.

BTW - The spot outside on the street to eat your slice is world-class on a nice day.
author: Adam S.

description: Their 4 cheese pizza literally melts in your mouth !!! Don't forget to try a slice of it if you are around.
author: Bharat g.

description:
Their main establishment had a 2hr wait time so we came here. I really wanted to try this place out since people said it was some of the best pizza around and I was craving ravioli. I can't judge wholly based on their main establishment, but this place isn't so great.

Sicilian combo pizza: 3.5/5 - This was actually pretty decent because it wasn't oily. I loved the thick and crispy crust as well as the taste of the combo pizza even though i'm not a big fan of combo pizza.

Cheese pizza: 2/5 - This was so oily and nasty. I didn't like how it was so floppy and thin. At least make the crust crispy if it's going to be thin! The taste was ok but i felt like I was getting fat eating this.

Pepperoni pizza: 3/5 - This was a little better than the cheese because their pepperoni was good but still super oily.

I got 3 slices of pizza and although they were pretty big, I paid over $15 for subpar pizza.

There's only one table on the inside and a couple outside. It sucks when it's cold and you don't want to eat outside, but that's what you get when you don't make it early to eat at their main establishment.
author: Jenny L.

description:
For our office lunch on Friday, January 22nd, we ordered pizza delivered through Caviar. I think the scheduled delivery time was around 12:30pm. It arrived a little before 12:45pm.

Prices below are what was paid through Caviar. I compared prices to their online menu and all items are priced more: Caesar (+$1.35 each) and Pizza (+$4.80 each). So both items were priced 15% more.

*Caesar Salad: Caesar dressing with romaine, house croutons, parmigiano, white anchovies ($10.35 Each x5)
*New York 20" Pizza: Salami, pepperoni, mushrooms, sausage, garlic ($36.80)
*New York 20" Pizza: Potato, bacon, garlic, rosemary, feta, pesto ($36.80)
*New York 20" Pizza ($33.35): Pepperoni (+$3.45)

Let me preface by saying I adore Tony's pizza! I've had it numerous times. The toppings are always top notch and the crust is always soft with a great chew. I don't know if it was the size of the pizzas we ordered, but there was too much crust on these slices. Granted, the pizza was huge, but I was left with this giant piece of bread at the end. It felt like a waste. I wish they made the crust smaller so we'd get more toppings and sauce. Also, since we got the pizzas delivered, they weren't that hot, so the crust was extra chewy. It was kinda like a jaw work out.

I've had their pepperoni before. Always a solid pie. The meat, mushroom, and garlic pie was also good. I adore mushrooms and garlic. I thought the potato and bacon pie was okay. I'm not a huge fan of feta, so this was my least favorite slice. I loved the caesar salad! I adore anchovies, so this was definitely my kind of caesar. Since we got five salads, they packaged it up into one giant salad.

This is the 2nd time I've had delivery from Tony's and it's not quite the same. The crust gets a little too chewy as it cools. Though, if I'm craving a slice and low on time, the slice house will always do.
author: Elena N.

description: Absolutely the best pizza in the United States! Hands down beats the rest without question! Must visit at least once in your life! Outstanding customer service and pleasant atmosphere!
author: Tony E.

description:
Not a lot of places for good New York style slice. I throughly enjoyed this pizza. 

$5-6/ slice
author: Vivian C.

description: Super friendly staff - they are 5 stars!  Food was ok.  Pizza was Luke warm and tough.  Literally broke my plastic fork trying to eat it. Could tell good ingredients and a bit pricey for what you get.  Not sure if I will return.
author: Robert C.

description: Yum! Love how you can order it not heated, and it's legit delish cold pizza! Huge pieces, lots of flavor. We got the purple potato. Crust is on point, not too thick, not too thin.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Tony's was closed and this place hit the spot. Nothing like grabbing a slice for lunch and enjoying each bite on a nice sunny day. 

I got the California Veggie and it was pretty yummy. The prices are decent but still more than Golden Boy around the corner (for the square pizza slice, that reminds you of elementary school lunch). Service was nice and a line can build up because of the lunch crowd. 

Not bad for stumbling on the place.
author: J. T.

description:
The pizza is good, but the service is poor. Prepare yourself for either a long wait or not having the correct order. Maybe even both!
I tried to call in my order to avoid waiting, and I had a long wait time even over the phone. I had to repeat myself numerous times and I figured since I had my ordered verified there would be no confusion. I was wrong. I had an order of calamari and they did not include any dipping sauces or lemon. I had marinara sauce included on the side, which I was charged for as "ranch." Lesson learned...can't trust this establishment to get an order correct no matter how many times I repeat it. Check your order before you walk out the door!
author: Suzie A.

description: Incredible pizza! The meatballs as a side were incredible. We had the Americano pizza  which was really great, and the Picante Pizza which was also great and very original and tasty. This place is among the best I've ever been. Until next time....
author: Chris H.

description: So rude :( They're used to dealing with drunk people. Someone took our pizza and we were blamed for not getting it. The guy behind the counter (Damon) immediately turned extremely hostile and rude. "I remember my first time ordering pizza." Passive aggressively trying to charge for a to go box after we had already paid for one. Insinuating that we were in some way patronizing him because he was behind the counter at a pizza restaurant. So unfortunate from such an iconic spot.
author: Nick P.

description:
Tony's Slice House is the place to grab a quick sandwich, calzone or slice of pie.  The line is long but it moves really quickly.  On a sunny day, I like to grab my meal and walk across the street to Washington Square and dine on the grass.

It goes without saying, this is some of the best pizza in the city.  My favorite is the Margherita, simple but so delicious.

The Chicago style Italian beef sandwich is the best that I've found in SF.  Order it dipped with extra giardiniera, which is the traditional spicy, chunky relish made of peppers, okra and other vegetables from Chicago.  The Italian beef is super tasty on a cool winter day.

Tony's Slice House has popped up in other locations around the city but this spot in North Beach is the original and best!
author: Lance W.

description: Stopped here for a slice of pizza, while I was on a weekend trip to San Francisco. I'm originally from Brooklyn and let me tell you this slice of pizza was heaven in my mouth. The crust was soooo good the cheese everything! The only complaint I have is how tiny the establishment is, you tend to get cramped up and we waited a while for just a slice. All in all it was very good!
author: Pamela R.

description: A place for true pizza lovers. Multi ovens for multi types of pizza. This is our 4th time there and not sure which pizza is my favorite . You'll definitely want to come back for more
author: Constance F.

description: I'm just one of those really weird people who doesn't care for pizza. I know..... go on..gasp, stare and point in horror. I don't get it! It's just a slice of really greasy baked dough with toppings. I may never understand all those weirdos who live for pizza. Anyway, so with that, I'm not a pizza pro, but Tony's slice was tasty, although quite greasy. I'm not a fan, but I can imagine if I were a pizza lover, this could be good.
author: Athena L.

description: Delicious mouthwatering hot crispy thin crust pizza. I couldn't get enough! Meatlovers slice was salty,  greasy and satisfying. Im drooling thinking about it right now!
author: K L.

description: There are only two joints I hit in North Beach for pizza. Golden Boy for that thick, doughy, hangover cure, and Tony's, for that thin-crust, smoky artisanal flava flave. I usually hit the Slicehouse and take my slice to-go, as seating there is a bit difficult to find if you're stopping by in the evening, because it's always poppin. The pizza is so hot I've burned the roof of my mouth flesh. Don't give two sh*ts though, it's good. Try the purple potato. Or the pepperoni, a classic. Fold your slice in half, take a big bite, and let those greasy juices flow, man. Life's too short to eat sh*tty pizza.
author: Justine K.

description:
So my buddies and I were originally supposed to Tony's Pizzeria, but because the wait time was an hour and forty five, we were ridiculously hungry and decided to go next door, and ordered a NY Meat Lover's pizza.  The pie was $32--and sure, might sound steep, but the pizza tasted delicious.  We had to wait a half hour for the order, and made our way to a local bar. When we came back, we were stoked to enjoy our delicious meal.  

The slices of pizza are gigantic.  One slice will fill up one.  Because it was the 3 of us, and some homeless bum asked if we were willing to share, we did of course.  It did help us kill the rest of the pizza.  We were so full afterward, and it definitely satisfied my hunger. 

The one drawback about this store is that seating is extremely limited.  I get it though-the store is meant for those who want to call in and pick up a pie to take home, not for dine in.  Even then, there was a small outdoor eating area. 

Overall, I was very satisfied with my meal, and plan on coming back on my next visit. 

Overall grade: A
author: Bobby K.

description: Did tonys slice due to the wait for the restaurant.  Was good pizza and enjoyed Sitting outside eating pizza.  Better descriptions may be helpful.
author: Deb R.

description: Decent pizza, but the staff seems a bit frustrated and can be a little rude. I also didn't like that they didn't have to-go boxes. My wife and I really struggled to carry and bring home a set of four slices. We also always struggle to find parking in the area. It can take 30-60 minutes just to find parking. Definitely not our first choice when it come to pizza in SF. We can order better pizza for the price of the four slices we ordered an that also comes in a box. Save your money unless you are just strolling by and happen to be hungry (some of the restaurants in the area can have a rather long wait..
author: Yrev T.

description:
First off, by all accounts, it seems Tony can do no wrong.

If you're after a quick meal instead of a sit down, involved meal, then Tony's Slice House is a perfect solution.

But, unlike what other yelpers have stated, the options here are barely a fraction of what's available at the full service restaurant next door.  It's no contest.

But, we don't always need 20 pizza variety options, do we?  

We stopped in last night after trying the newest new neighborhood joint, BarNua.  

There were about 8 or 9 pie flavors to choose from, & 2 different crust styles; thick or thin.  There are also calzones & sammies for heartier fare.

The service was outstanding.  The cashier greeted us like he knew us, took our order, & then, as our order was being filled, he asked us what we'd been up to tonight.  He then went on to tell us about another couple that had come in earlier that had also just checked out a new spot in the hood.  We were made to feel like primo regulars, even though I'd never actually been here before.  I've always gone next door.  I didn't get his name, but what a prince of a guy & an employee.  Props.

We went w 2 picante slices.  Our order was plated for us in about a minute.  Sweet.  (If you order a sammy, or there are a lot people waiting in front of you, your wait may be longer).  This pizza was flavorfully potent, the crust had bite, w good texture contrasts between the toppings, the base, & the creamy, smooth peaks of mozzarella.  

The only thing for me is that I like a more crispy crust.  I want it crispy everywhere & throughout.  This was solid w bite, but it did have a soft component.  It was not soggy at all (most importantly), just a softer bite.  There's a big difference.

All seating is outside, except for one booth that seats about 6.  Only one table in the house?  Kinda cool.

Perfect for a casual lunch or casual night.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
YAS! A great way to get your Tony's fix without having to wait an hour or two for the restaurant.

Most of the pizza is by the slice, but you can get a few of his legendary whole pizzas here including my favorite pizza of all time: The New Yorker. For your reading pleasure, the toppings are Pepperoni, House-Made Calabrese and Fennel Link Sausage, Ricotta, Garlic, Oregano, Pecorino Romano, Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce. http://bit.ly/1DqsVnD

So I couldn't figure out what makes Tony's pizza so good...then I realized it's everything. His attention to detail, the cheese, the toppings, the crust (I'm not a crust eater, but I finish these!), and the oven. He's sort of a Pizza god.

Only downsides for the Slice House are that you can't get the full menu (so none of the awesome meatballs) and there is very limited seating.

I haven't tried any of the sandwiches, but those Italian beef dips are calling my name next time...
author: Adrienne H.

description: I've got to give this place 4 stars. Every time I'm in the city I come here simply because the pizza is the best in the country.   Parking , traffic is a real hassle but its worth it.  The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the dopey slugs at the counter are rude and treat the customers poorly as i witnessed firsthand yesterday.  If i wanted a fat sassy girl to pay no mind to me while handing over money for a product I'd stay in oakland.  Please get better counter help that are cheerful and happy to be there and you will get 5 stars from everybody.   See you soon , as soon as i can find a place to park
author: Erik B.

description: One of the locals we befriended recommended us this pizza spot and boy we're we in for a treat. One of the best pizzas I have ever tasted. Upside was that all the food was simply delicious, downside of it all is that you gotta go with a mindset ready to wait for a while to get a table. There's always a line and for a good reason the pizza is perfect!
author: Ty-Lin G.

description: Ate here on a recommendation from Leo on the Big Bus tour San Francisco.  Outstanding pie!!  This is the best pizza I've had outside of Boston or New York!  We had the Pepperoni, Californian and the Sicilian,  great cheese and crust!  Every bite was better than the last! If your in little Italy, or San Francisco as a whole you have to try a slice here!
author: Sean L.

description:
Will never say no to Tony's pizza.

You can't go wrong with most of their pizza.

Just a combo or pepperoni would make me a happy camper.  I want to try a sit down dinner there one of these days.

Keep up the great work guys,  Once I'm off my diet I'm grabbing a slice.
author: Lyman C.

description: If you want a taste of New York or even San Francisco 30 years ago. This is your place. It is the type of pizza soooo good that , plain cheese or just pepperoni is heavenly.
author: Larry S.

description:
Another SF pizza place off the bucket list! ...Ok, technically speaking the bookmark was for the Tony's sitdown restaurant and not the quickie, let's-get-a-slice-and-bounce spot. But hey, I was in a hurry and I didn't need more than a slice.

Got the New York Meat Lover's pizza. All I can say is that this was definitely one of the best slices of pizza I've ever had. Perfect amount of cheese and tomato sauce, topped with plentiful pepperoni and sausage, and the absolute perfect amount of crust (crunchy, but not too crispy)! Secret Pizza in the Cosmopolitan has most likely fueled my recent preference for New York-style pizza, but Tony's takes that next level.

The only sucky part of this place is that it's nigh impossible to find a parking spot around North Beach. Pretty much the only "complaint" I can have, because the rest is perfecto.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
The slices were burned.
The slices were greasy.
The slices had No cheese.
It's Expensive. They even charge you for the box!!!
Do yourself a favor and don't go.
author: Masama S.

description:
We stopped here mid Segway tour for a quick pizza break. Small little place, understaffed, but the pizza was pretty good. I appreciate that it's some of the larger slices I've had, though the price is a bit insane. We paid $5-$6 per slice and had 2 (though they messed up the order and we ended up with 3). 

Wait time was a bit longer than I had expected given we were only one of the few in line, but the pizza made up for it. 

I only give it a 4 out of 5 stars because the service was... interesting. The staff hardly spoke English and the line built up because they couldn't operate efficiently - hence why our pizza took longer then expected. 

Enjoyed the pizza on my segway and would go back again.
author: Alexander C.

description: Tony's Napoletana next door had a 1 hour and 15 minute wait, so we found Tony's Slice House next door for some pizza. My friend got two slices for a vegetarian. I had the calzone. They only offer one calzone. It could have had a more tasty combination inside, but I enjoyed eating it and felt stuffed.
author: Denise C.

description:
This used to be a great pizza place. Now prices are too high, customer service is terrible and the quality of product is bad (over cooked re-re-warmed slices of pizza) for $5.
I ordered a slice of cheese and asked them not to over cook it just to warm it up because it's a slice that has been sitting there already cooked and all it needed is just a quick warmup but the kids they got working here are pretty careless and don't seem to listen to customers. So I had to turn my slice back twice and the third time I got pepperoni slice and I'm vegetarian. At the end I just told them to give me a cold slice of cheese, which I'm eating now and I'm just not happy with it.
author: Gabriel N.

description:
Ah-No. I would not go back. Being an east coast girl I know a good pie and this was not it. Ordered a cheese and a New Yorker. Cheese was OK, but not much better than average and the New Yorker was awful, not to mention burnt. 
Worse than the over rated pizza was the attitude of the woman behind the counter who insisted we did not order a New Yorker after losing the receipt we had given her to prove it. We finally found where she had "lost" it in the deli counter and had one of the other employees fish it out. (he was scared to BTW) 
After waiting for more than an hour we finally got our food and it totally wasn't worth it. Not sure what all the hype is about. 
Did I mention two pies cost almost $50.00? Yikes!
author: Matilda A.

description: Solid place to get a HUGE slice if you don't want to wait in line for a table. You only have certain selections but they are all fantastic. Thank you again Tony Gemignani for finishing off a long day and long drive from Rocklin with a satisfying slice.
author: Tim M.

description: A delicious slice. Take what's available when you show up. If you're not picky go with whichever pie is fresh out of the oven!
author: J. R.

description: Had a sketchy experience here just tonight.  I ordered two slices for my girlfriend and I (from the Slice House) and it was brought out on my plates.  I asked the employee if he didn't mind giving us a to go box.  He seemed displeased that I asked him but he reluctantly grabbed it and said it was 50 cents.  I offered two quarters and he asked me to drop it in the tip jar.   Really???  I dropped them in but once he turned around I took them back out.  Kind of sketchy.  Pizza is decent.  Employee was kind of rude.
author: Martin S.

description: Went here on a San Francisco trip. Did expect to have the best...damn...slice of pizza I've ever had. I got the 4-cheese slice(5.50) at around 11 o'clock and it was damn impressive, better than Joe's. My cousins agreed, they said it was the god slice. We even came back again hours later for another slice. Funny enough, it wasn't as good as that first damn slice of god pizza. 5-stars just for the tale of the God-sent slice
author: Tommy From Ono's L.

description: Excellent service and amazing award winning pizza. The waitress was accommodating to my sister's pickiness. All around a great restaurant to dine in.
author: Marixa H.

description: Being born and raised in NJ I really miss a good pizza living in the Central Valley. Thats why when we decided to go on a trip to SF i knew I'd want a good Italian pizza. Yelped this place and it did not disappoint. MUST TRY. nothing better than being 8 months pregnant and walking around all day in chilly SF and then sitting down to eat a warm brick oven baked pizza! We had the cheese and veggie. It was melt in your mouth goodness. The crust was perfectly crunchy and soft where it needed to be  And even though it was a busy weekend night the pizza came out pretty fast.
author: R K.

description: Good pizza, but the "prize winning" New Yorker was nothing close to what I had in New York.  Three stars because the service was a major issue; waited a long time for a sandwich, and the cashier never acknowledged me standing there for a long time waiting.  Even when I asked, he could barely bother to check for me.  I am a big fan of Tony and his humble beginning (as far back as his Castro Valley days), but I am sure he would be disappointed to know that his empire is run by people who don't really care.
author: C P.

description:
Francisco(cashier) was rude! He gave us a vegetarian style pizza with meat in it.

When I brought it to his attention he pretty much told me to F off and that there was nothing he was willing to do about it.
author: Omid D.

description:
Say it with me ya'll -- OVER RATED.

The prices are ridiculous and while the presentation of the margherita is quite nice, it fails on every other level. Completely uninspiring pizza and I have no idea why it's been voted some of the best. 

For my birthday weekend, my partner and I did a little pizza tour stopping at avellino's, golden boy, and tony's slice house. If you want pizza, go to Avellino's and call it a day.
author: Priti K.

description:
We first went to the Tony's Pizza sit down restaurant next door on a Saturday night and the wait was 1.5 hours. Decided to look for another pizza place and we 'happened' upon the Tony's Pizza Slice house next door. Can't believe we missed this at first! There was still a line to grab slices, but the wait was much more reasonable. Each slice was huge! One could be a meal. 

My boyfriend ordered the gluten-free Prosciutto and Pear pizza. It took about 30 minutes to make, about $28. It was one of the best gluten-free pizzas he had. The crust tasted like a normal thin crust pizza and the toppings were delicious. I think this was expensive for a pizza, even gf but it's San Francisco prices I guess.
author: Ellen Z.

description:
I've enjoyed Tony's Slides House many times and though the service never been great, understandably because of the high rate of tourism and annoying customers, the pizza has been outstanding. 

But what got me to write this review was a terribly acted scam in which the woman cashier tried to steal my change when I handed her $100 bill to pay for our pizza. 

Instead of handing me $63 and some change she handed me $3 and some change then with her head down quickly walked away from the register. 

Minutes later she returned from the back of the slice house, finally looked me in the eye and without me having to say a word he said, "oh you gave me a 100 didn't you?"

This scam may have worked on a few scared and lost tourists but I am a local and I plan on returning to Tony's in the future. But I never want to experience an employee trying to steal my money again. I hope that management takes care of this brand damaging problem.
author: Matt C.

description:
Cashier who rung us up was rude and unfriendly...kind of like I was bothering him to order pizza. The vegetarian slice we ordered was great when we finally got it (15mins later). I checked on the slice after 12min with a complaining kid in tow and another cashier (looked more like a manager) had the audacity to tell me that someone else took my slice..We were in there the whole time and they never called our number or mentioned our slice. My guess is they forgot and didn't have the decency to tell us they screwed up. In any case the guy didn't apologize and two minutes later our slice came out. 

Unfortunately we didn't learn our lesson. We came back for a cheese slice because our son was hungry and it was close to where we were. The slice came out tasting like cardboard. Not sure what happened to the cheese...maybe it had been sitting out for too long or reheated incorrectly. 

I would encourage anyone to going here to go with low expectations...customer service sucks.
author: Mayur K.

description: I spent $15 on two slices of pizza. Then I say "can I have a cup of water?" The person behind the counter gives me a look and goes "Please?" Uh okay so I guess I have to say please for free water. "Please" for  your overpriced tourist trap shitburg pizza and "thank you" for the best thing on the menu - the water!
author: Devanshu P.

description: Pizza was delicious! The slice itself was huuuuge! Loved it! Employees were very nice. We sat outside to enjoy the city views and fresh air. Definitely recommend!
author: Yesenia T.

description:
The food is very good - the New Yorker is absolutely something I look forward to once a year - when I fly in from the east coast. Unfortunately this time the usual 1 1/2 hour wait was met with poor service, a table way to small for a party of 5, and the waiter forgot to bring our wine and to put in our pizza order  - which meant after waiting 1 1/2 hours we had to keep waiting . Worst part was he didn't really seem to care . It seems like they are now to busy to really care about their costumers experience. Even the hostess seemed to enjoy telling you there was at least a 1 1/2 hour wait - kinda strange.
I will only get it to go from now on :-(
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I'm gonna go ahead and just give five stars, been here a few times now, the only bad thing I will say is they don't always have the Pizza slice you want right away. And it can be a lil greasy but that's what napkins are for. The four cheese is always bomb! I like this place because I walk up see what's ready and order and I haven t had a complaint.  Think I will try one of the subs next, they sound appetizing on the menu....
author: B A.

description:
I've been to the restaurant a couple times, but this was the first time I went to the Slice House. I ordered a juicy Cheef Italian beef sandwich and it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had, seriously. It was that delicious. 

"Juicy" means they dip the whole sandwich (meat and bread) into au jus. You can get it two other ways as well- without dipping or soak the sandwich in it. This was perfect though. The meat was great. It's thinly sliced, not fatty, and they pack a good amount in. The best part was the au jus. It was so good and flavorful, dripping into the plate. The bread, also, wasn't soggy and still had a crispiness to it.

I can't wait to come back and ordered that again.
author: Matt L.

description:
If you're reading this, you are a wise person because you are not only on the search for really good pizza, you also are reading a review written by a really awesome person. Haaa just kidding. 

But seriously, if you're looking for a some SEERIOUSLY good and gigantic slices of 'za, walk around the block from the highly over-rated Golden Boy, and hit up Tony's. It's amazing, cheap, hot, delicious, life-changing.
author: Crystal C.

description: Went here yesterday , service was terrible . The cashier ( I think Eastern European ) rang up two slices and a calzone . I told her I didn't order a calzone and don't want this . She was combative and argued that I did order a calzone , and she wasn't going to take it back. That's when things escalated, and the manager got in my face and was screaming that I assaulted her . I explained to her that I didn't touch her and if you are going to accuse people for assault , she should know the definition . Then  screamed for us to leave . I told her not till you take off the 8.50 for the calzone I didn't order . She finally fix the problem, and reverse the charge from my boyfriend's credit card . I go to the one in Vegas all the time . Won't be back to this location ever again. I know it was only 8.50 , but it's the principle.
author: PAIGE L.

description: Everyone has always told me to come here. The best pizza in SF!! Second time here. Pepperoni pizza. Too greasy. Maybe the prosciutto is better? I might try that next time. I am Italian and Brazilian, very hard to please me when it comes to pizza, or Italian food. Nobody's fault. It is what it is. I grew up eating authentic Italian food. Anyone that has tried knows what I am talking about. They are not bad, but not it yet.
author: Claudia B.

description:
This review is for the Slice House.  We took a pedal cab from Pier 33 to the Filbert Steps and he recommended Tony's as the best pizza, if we were hungry later.  After walking up the Steps and hanging out at Coit Tower for a bit, we definitely were! 

Awesome pizza!  Huge slice, so it's reasonably priced for what you get.  We got two slices of pepperoni to go.  They were kind of busy, so we had a little bit of a wait and there isn't a lot of space to stand inside.  They have a great little sidewalk patio area, though.
