description: Pizza was yummy, lady taking orders was extra grouchy :(
author: Jessica P.

description: Had to stop here before heading back home, the slice pizza are super yummy, calzone was amazing with perfect flavor. The  customer service was great too. Must try
author: Nancy L.

description: Got a slice of cheese pizza from the slice house today. Extremely delicious and service was fast & friendly.
author: Isabella K.

description: Since tony's napolitana was very busy when we passed we decided to go with a slice and a coke. Since we're used to belgian pizzas we never had anything like this before and we thought it was absolutely epic! We went with a peperoni and a four cheese and went back for seconds! If my wife wasn't there to stop me i would've probably went back in for thirds!
author: Cornelis T.

description:
So, the pizza's not really a 1-star, it's a 5.  I sing Tony's praises all the time and I'm sure I'll continue to.  I just had a strange experience though so i wanted to get their attention to get it fixed.  I've ordered to-go pizza from here religiously for the past 8 months (I had a baby 8 months ago) and I just went to get the Sausage and Stout, but was told that they never do this to go.  Not true, I did it last month.  I challenged this a little but didn't want to be a jerk.  Apparently the story is now that this has only ever been for dining in.

First thought was "not true", because it's not.  Second thought was, "why?".  Are the locals your bread & butter?  The wait is long and it's hard to get in, particularly when you have a baby.  I hope this doesn't sound like I'm an entitled local, but I really just want access to the same great pizza options as everyone else.  It's already hard enough to not have kids and I've had like 1,000 New Yorkers, Honey Pies, Cal Italias, and Camparis, and I need to change it up sometimes.

Don't get me wrong, I'll keep ordering, but I'll probably have a chip on my shoulder.  Maybe just put it on the menu, if it's not something that I can order, and then I'll be totally fine.  I just can't handle the uncertainty of not being able to get any great pizza on the menu, any time I want (during business hours).
author: David P.

description:
Best pizza my wife and I have ever eaten hands down.

We ordered three slices ($5.50 a slice - great price for how big they are)

1. NY Meat Lover - this one was my favorite. They cooked it just right so it was crunchy but not too crispy. The pepperoni was money.

2. The Picante - this came in a close second. I was worried it was going to be really hot/spicy but it wasn't at all. 

3. The California Veggie - this was solid but it wasn't amazing. 

The place was packed as far as sitting down and eating at Tony's  so we just ordered from The Slice which is right next door. We ordered and had our food within 15 minutes. The guy who was our cashier was cool and knowledgable. He told us to get The Picante and we loved it.

Go here if you're wanting a solid place to eat some pizza. There is a cool little park you can eat at across the street too.
author: Steve W.

description:
I thought this would be a Pizza that blows me away but unfortunately it just kept me right in reality.
To mention here is that I did not go into the restaurant but took one slice to go. I am aware that the choice is much smaller there but quality should actually just be the same.

My order was the Pizza California (I think) - the one with some veggies and onions on it. I really must say that I did have better Pizzas and I am not comparing it to the Italian ones because this is certainly an Americanized version of Pizza. Which does not matter, I usually also like this one. But here I did not have the happy face after the first bite - the taste blending was a little lame and there was so much cheese on it that I could almost not handle it. I liked the crust, somehow but all in all the slice was quite fatty and somehow the ingredients did not create this awesome taste I was looking for.

Maybe, one day, I will try out the restaurant because I saw on the pictures that Tony's has some crazy Pizza creations. This would be an interesting experiment.
For now, I can say that I will try other places before going back...
author: Vera H.

description: Best pizza I had while in San Francisco. Perfectly cooked, thin and crispy like it should be. Fast service, good prices. They even had a good selection of old fashioned sodas with a working old school coke machine, pretty cool!
author: Nick G.

description:
I've been here 5+ times.  It's a by the slice/pie pizza shop in North Beach.  Slices are delicious and priced for the area.  Easy in easy out if you're walking, not so much if your driving.

I'd definitely go back.
author: EJ N.

description: Best NY-style slice in SF. Yes, it's pricey at $5+ per slice, but it's worth it. I love their sausage and usually enjoy the pepperoni, but sometimes pepperoni makes the slice too oily.
author: Victoria J.

description: These people clearly have no idea how to make pizza. Soggy crust, Romano cheese, $5-6 a slice. Don't waste your time.
author: Steve C.

description:
completely overrated. I went with a friend who thought it was better than golden boy but then we sat on the bench next to somebody who bought golden boy and ate tony's pizza slice side by side and proclaimed golden boy the winner.

 I didn't have golden boy to compare it with but I know if blondies or fat slice would beat this award winning pizza, then for sure golden boy would. It was tasteless, dry and I threw half of it in the trash. I couldn't keep eating it. To be fair, I am vegetarian so I could only judge on the cheese slice. I feel if you cant make a cheese slice then you shouldn't be making pizza. 

I do make my own pizza from scratch so I have high standards. Then again I didn't like pizza in NYC, I lived there 2 years visited all the must eat joints for pizza and left scratching my head. Am I missing something, is thin limp greasy salty pizza the norm everywhere else. I would hate to have been raised with that as the gold standard. The best pizza place I ever had, blew zachary's and patxis out of the water. It was pizza chicago on beach street near the pier 39. It was ethereal and you needed a knife and fork to eat it. Too bad that place closed. I will still be on the hunt for decent pizza. Until then I'll be making my own.
author: Onika C.

description:
I got this place recommended by the guide of my guided tour (SF wild tours) and wasn't disappointed.
 I had a pepperoni & cheese stromboli and I loved it! The dough was perfectly fresh, crusty and tasty. The tomato sauce they use, which seemed homemade, was also worth to mention.
author: Audrey B.

description: The service and food are tops. Deep fried green beans were delicious. Can't say enough good things about the dough of the pizza. Service was prompt and friendly. Price wasn't a bargain, but didn't expect a bargain given its location.
author: Art C.

description:
If you're looking for a quick bite by the slice and want a nice place to enjoy what sf offers... then this would be your go to place. It's tucked away so you have to pay attention. The food is great. I had the meat stuffed pizza by the slice and I can say it filled me up and was enjoyable to eat. Avg price I'd say not more than 12.00 including a soda. Outside seating really allows you to enjoy the food you just bought. 
The pizza- not too greasy, easy to eat,full of flavor. You won't leave entirely full but you won't be hungry anymore.
author: Nikole D.

description:
YUP 3 stars. This has pheonominal pizza, but it seems like they have gotten used to catering to locals...  for those who don't know there is no middle class in SF and the median income in above 70000 annually. You are either rich or you are poor.  This place is one of those many places that have gotten used to serving rich out of towners.. you know tourists.. and rich locals.. much like Mama's across the street, or Tacolicious a few steps down. 

For starters IF you are greeted when you walk in it is usually by some snappy chick who looks and act's like she's mad at the world because her last punk rock album didn't pick up and she got dropped from her indie band as a lead. I swear to get this chick to smile you have to tip her five dollars MINIMUM. Why would they have her communicating with customers if she obviously has major social issues.  She's mean. And she will pretend like you arent their if you dont make your presence known. I've come here at least 4 times, and Knowing that she will be taking my order every-time I go for lunch always makes me think twice about coming here, or going to portico which also has good tasting Pizza at a more reasonable price.. 

Which brings up my next reason this place doesn't cut it for my fan-dome. The price. As I aforementioned The place caters to the rich locals and tourists who have come expecting to spend money.. which is fine, but I feel like it scares off loyalists who would come weekly. In fact everyone I talked to about this place says the same thing.. Its too expensive and they usually only come when they are in the neighborhood. It's just not worth the price.  I know much better places that will give you  2 slices and a drink for 5 bucks.
author: Vinny T.

description:
A great pizzeria serving high quality pizza with a fair price. Their pizza comes with generous topping, the pizza base is very delicious, crunchy, perfect thickness for a thin crust pizza. The California (vegetarian) was ok for me, the mushrooms were a bit over powering, but the pepperoni, cheese, combination, calzone were all very good. Combination is my personal favorite!

If you're after the award winning Tony's margherita pizza, you need to visit the Tony's Pizza Restaurant next door to the left. The slice house doesn't have the same pizza though its margherita pizza is delicous too.
author: Lianne M.

description: Officially dethroned John's pizza in NYC for the title of "Best Pizza Ever."  The meat lovers steals the show.
author: S W.

description:
Heard a lot about this place .. and it didn't dissapoint.   I've taken half a dozen colleagues back here and they've all agreed this is the best pizza in SF.  hands down! 

I count the number of healthy days and workouts in between the times i can head back down to pig out on some great pizza.
author: bill b.

description: Just poor customer service. Wait around to be acknowledged right at the counter and they take the person behind you. Not the first time. 0/10.
author: Aaron H.

description: While I have obviously not been to every pizza place in the country, from what I have been too (a whole lot) Tonys is definitely the best. Multiple oven options (the 1100 degree coal fired is still my favorite) great meats and pairings and a knowledgeable friendly staff really round it out. On the restaurant side you can also enjoy great pastas, sides and salads and Peroni on draft! This is my version of Heaven. I never visit the Bay Area without visiting Tonys. Mostly I go to the smaller pizza shop, but sometimes we go to the sit down side. Both are excellent and not to be missed. If you are looking for the coal fired, make sure to not got between 3-4 pm where they clean it and it is not available.
author: chris v.

description: Sometimes you dont have the luxury of hanging out and eating Tony's in the restaurant proper. So we went next door to pick up some slices before heading out. My friend has a gluten allergy and they were able to accommodate as they have a separate oven in an area that's away from cross contamination. Got a simple pepperoni and it hit the spot. THe unfortunate thing is sometimes you get the drunken waves of North Beach A-holes but I guess that's to be expected. Still good fare though
author: Kim N.

description: A single slice is large! The crust is not too thick, but a little chewy. My jaw was a little sore after.. Overall good pizza though! The meat lover's was very oily but that was expected. Small location but perfect for grabbing on the go. There are a few tables to sit outside which is great for when the weather is nice. It didn't take too long from when we ordered and it was a very busy night
author: Katrina M.

description: My friends and I shared a whole pizza and ordered the margharita and one with just cheese and fresh cut up tomatoes (no sauce).  Both pizzas were nicely done and was the perfect quick stop for lunch to eat on the run.  Will definitely stop in the next time I'm in that part of town.
author: Susan C.

description: If you don't want to wait in the long lines to sit at the restaurant you can wait in this line a little less and walk away with a few a slices. The pizza is so damn good.
author: Susan H.

description: Oh my gosh It's the way Pizza should be!!! Slight Virgin Olive Oil crunch even on the bottom!I usually don't eat the crust but this one is awesome!
author: Jan H.

description: I used to be a regular and absolutely loved the place. But today was terrible, and I normally don't like to give negative reviews for places I love. The service was slow (the solo cashier was on the phone and kitchen movement was slow).  They got my order wrong, and was annoyed when they needed to transfer the slices from the plates to a box (their mistake).   But what really pissed me off (and the two star review) was not the slowness,  attitude and wrong order.   It was the burnt to a crisp pizza slices.  They were like hard crackers.  (Probably because the kitchen moved so slow when the slices were being heated.). A waste of good pizza.
author: Linda T.

description: Best pizza in North Beach...and if you like the New York or "Roman" Italian style pizza breads, you will enjoy this style of pizza.  The have crispy crust and homemade sauce...and the rest of the fresh ingredients are primo.  There are no reservations...and it can get busy during he peak meal times, so go off peak times. There is a Parklet out front that provides outdoor seating besides the limited indoor seating.
author: Mitzi A.

description: Avoid the wait and grab a slice. I like that it's a random slice of whatever they decided to make. I had the mozzarella and basil Margarita pizza. It was delicious.
author: Shelley D.

description: My boyfriend is by far the pickiest eater you've ever met! As a chicago native, he raves it's the best food city in the US. I was shocked when we had to return to Tony's twice during our recent visit to San Francisco. I met Tony when he was promoting his cookbook and Chicago and knew my boyfriend would love the food. He said the Italian beef was the best he's ever tasted and even better than Al's #1 or Johnnie's beef in Chicago which he eats once per week. I was so happy to find this place! Tony, we love you and please open a restaurant in Chicago. I swear my boyfriend will quit his job and come work for you. The pizza is amazing as well.
author: Meggan R.

description:
This place was a great surprise! I was discouraged when I strolled up to Tony's next door (my intended destination) and saw that it had a line out the door. Since I was alone I was in the mood for a place with counter service anyway, so this version of Tony's was a better choice. The stromboli looked the most intriguing, and I wasn't disappointed. (In fact, I visited the following week to order it again!) 

I'm usually not a huge fan of pepperoni, but everything about this was perfect. Quality ingredients and big flavor. I loved that the top of the stromboli was crusted with a mix of garlic, parmesan, and italian spices. Every bite was great, and I was able to bring a chunk of it home for later. For $7, it was a great value.
author: Jessi M.

description: Sicilian combo is the best thing that has ever happened to me. The bread is almost donut-like so fluffy and chewy.
author: Dana W.

description: Lunch with coworkers at least once a week. This traditional beef sandwich is soaked and lots of favor. If you cannot handle a big sandwich like this, then this is not the place for you.
author: Gil T.

description: The pizza was really good pretty oily, not bad for the price. Huge slices. Outdoor seating. The customer service was poor by my standards, pretty rude and pushy. Cut me off when I tried to pay and didn't address me once. Other than that it was decent.
author: Olivia B.

description: Oh yeah, that's pizza. North Beach, both slices and also pies next door. The pepperoni was perfectly done, all curled up at the edges, and crust was perfect. Sweet sweet sauce was the star here. This place deserves its rep.
author: Michele D.

description:
Worth walking to for lunch from SoMa (plus I can burn off the calories from a slice).

If you eat in the park though be careful, they want slices as well!
author: Janie L.

description: Great pizza. Inconsiderate staff who doesn't give a crap about the customers. Leave plenty of time. Expect to wait in a long line even for pick up. Expect to be told that despite being the only person in the place you'll have to wait 5 minutes for her to mess with the computer and iPad before they'll even take your order.
author: John S.

description:
Called to order a pizza and were told it would be an hour wait for delivery. An hour later they called and said "your pizza is ready but we don't deliver to your area so we'll give you a discount when you come pick it up." 

We have a brand new baby and were starving. Picking up our food was not an option this particular night. The girl on the phone was completely unapologetic and rude. We live less than a mile away and told them our address when we made the order so clearly this place has some things to figure out, such as common sense and good customer service.
author: Daffodil K.

description:
This is the slice house, which is next door to Tony's main pizza restaurant.  It's been open for a few years, but most of the yelp reviews for this place are ending up mixed in with the reviews of the main restaurant. http://www.yelp.com/biz/tonys-pizza-napoletana-san-francisco

The pizza here is delicious, and they also have a variety of other items such as calzones, strombolis, and sandwiches.  For the sandwiches they even roast the beef daily inside cast iron in the big coal oven, and slice it nice and thin with a beautiful vintage hand-crank deli slicer.  The only knock I have against this place is that the food is a little more expensive than I would expect at a pizza-by-the-slice place, and that it can get kind of slow when the small space is busy.

However once you get your food, all your past troubles are forgotten and you are transported to pure pizza bliss.
author: Steven Z.

description: Any way you slice it, great pizza. At $5 dollars a slice it's on the expensive end, but supply and demand I suppose. I went here twice in a three day period, I witnessed an employee hang up the phone on purpose to avoid a delivery call, not exactly professional but it is what it is.
author: Andrew H.

description: Everything about this place is right. The service was fabulous, and so was the food. We had the Margherita and the traditional pepperoni pizza. Both were to die for. We sat right at the pizza bar that allowed us to watch the pizza man at work. It was wonderful. Definitely worth the wait in line.
author: Brie D.

description: A lifesaver if you want pizza and don't feel like waiting 2 hours next door for a table. I've eaten at the sit-down Tony's several times but sometimes you want pizza and you want it NOW. For $5, you get a nice piece of pie (my choice is cheese) warmed up in the oven to go. Cross the street, plop yourself down on a bench in Washington Square Park, fold it up and shove into mouth. That's amore!
author: Bella L.

description:
They told me it was a must if you like pizza so we went to have a slice.
Excellent pizza. If you call during the dinner rush, you're liable to be put on hold or your call not answered. Patience is a must when placing an order for carry-out, but its well worth it!
The girl working seemed to care more about her friend who came in then taking care of her customers.
author: Lily M.

description: You can NEVER go wrong with this slice house. Absolutely mouthwatering! I've only cheese, pepperoni, meat lovers and their calzone, I would recommend all of them!
author: Diana A.

description:
Great pizza, great neighborhood vibe!
Stopped in for a slice on 9/20/14 and WOW!!
I had a slice of the Sicilian, which is a deep-dish type pizza with peppers, salami, thinly sliced onions, garlic and pancetta.  Absolutely delicious!!  Just writing the description makes me crave another slice!!

We will definitely be back..... And soon!!
author: Christine Z.

description:
Though there are several excellent options for pizza in this area alone, Tony's is by far one of the best.

Their pizza is cooked to perfection... The right amount of cheese (not making it too oily), their sauce has a hint of sweetness tasting delicious and they have a variety of styles and toppings allowing you to get something new each time you go.

We are definitely going back and we highly recommend this place to others.
author: R C.

description:
My fiancee and I came for the third time last night after we had an incredible first visit and an okay second visit (all about a year apart). I'm sad to say that what was once my favorite pizza that I've had from across the world has sunken much farther down on my list.
Service: The host was very nice and quoted us a 45 minute wait that ended up only being 10 minutes, which was great! It went downhill from here though. After we gave our order, we were brought our waters and our salad. I was pretty thirsty so I drank the water in about 2 minutes...and it was never refilled again for the half hour we were eating there. The waitress walked by several times, but never once offered. When she brought our pizza, she didn't offer cheese/pepper that all other tables had, so when I asked for cheese she gave me an annoyed 'okay' and brought it begrudgingly. The final turnoff was by the end of the meal, I realized that the waitress never once looked at me when asking how everything was, only to my fiancee. Don't get me wrong, I would rather her be treated well than me, but I would've appreciate a little love too!
Food: We got the 'seasonal salad', which yesterday was a limoncello and balsamic dressing with greens and topped with egg. The first bite was good, but honestly it was just wayyyy to much acid. I don't think I would ever be so pompous as to say something like that, but it seriously burned the tip of your tongue on the way in and was just sour. I had to force myself to eat every bite after the second. The pizza was fine, just smaller than I remember and the sauce not as unique. My expectations might have been too high, but I've had better for much less than 20 bucks a pie. 
Atmosphere: We sat outside which was really nice! The inside is always a bit loud, but what you'd expect from an italian joint.

Overall: I was sadly disappointed in this visit and my last. I'm not sure if it was just a fluke, but it seems like maybe Tony's is falling into the complacency trap of success. With all the competition in the area, I will be trying every other place in the area before I come give Tonys another chance. Not the worst restaurant I've had by any means, just a little disappointed.
author: Brad M.

description:
Oh, my word. Drool.

Despite my love for thin crust pizza, it took me a while to give this place a try because I was afraid it was over-hyped and touristy. What was I thinking going so long without having had Tony's pizza?!

Per Yelp recommendation, we ordered the Margherita and took it over to Washington Square Park for a little picnic. To me, the crust/dough makes or breaks a pizza, and Tony's has their dough down. It's incredibly chewy, yet melts in your mouth at the same time. I can't wait to go back and try all the other pizzas here. YUM.

Also, the cute old-school soda fridge and their glass bottle drinks are the perfect addition to the slice house!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
They make really tasty pies. I think that the coal fired oven is a nice touch. I frequently get the veggie. But sometimes to get the meat lovers. 

They have coke in the bottle. That's always delicious. Sometimes they have Stromboli. I have to say I'm a fan. 

Yum, I want a slice now.
author: Jason B.

description: I kind of drive from the Richmond to get a slice here. It's SO good. It's also the place that had me eating pepperoni after not eating it for 15 years because I found it so disgusting. It's actually crispy, spicy, and tasty here. Sorry rabbi.
author: Shushannah A.

description:
I walked all the way to North Beach for a giant meatball. I had the Meatball Gigante with an over easy fried egg on top and it was the best meal that I've ever had in my life. I had gone to the restaurant but the wait was an hour and a half, and was told I could order the giant one two doors down at the Slice House. The take out place is very small and there were many inconsiderate and ignorant people of all nationalities that after ordering refused to stand outside while the line was out the door.

After 15 minutes I walked away with a 1 lb. meatball in this incredible marinara sauce that was spicy and hot, never had a sauce like that before. It was incredible, because it was to go I had a container with sauce oozing out and ate while I walked so I couldn't take a picture, but a lady was watching me eat and I told her where to get some. Just incredible food and it was about $17.50.
author: N A.

description: This goes to Slice House. Awful service. The staff is unfriendly and needs an attitude adjustment. I went in to order a pizza to go. They said the wait time was about 25 minutes. I returned after half hour and it was not ready. Had to wait 15 more minutes. And the inside is just dirty, napkins, plastic utensils on the floor, empty pizza boxes left on the tables.
author: Andrey S.

description: Super friendly service and solid slice of pizza fro $5, wish I had a place like this near me in Amsterdam.
author: Zachary S.

description:
The girl at the counter was super rude to us and yelled at us for standing in front of the wrong register.. even though we were just following everyone else in lined. Who talks to their customers that way?

I can't believe they hire incompetent rude employees like her. Those guys in the back were worthless, too. Line went out the door and it went at a snail pace. 

So many other pizza places in the area. Don't waste your time and money here.
author: Linda B.

description: So I came here because his restaurant in Castro valley closed for some reason. The Castro valley restaurant was great so I was expecting a great pizza. Unfortunately on Tuesdays the main restaurant is closed and you can only get slices. So I had no choice but to get a couple of slices to try. I usually don't get slices because you can't judge a pizza if its been reheated. It needs to be fresh out of the oven to really experience the true flavor, texture, chewy Ness, etc. The first thing I noticed was that the pepperoni slice was picture perfect. So I took a picture. I usually douse my pizza with parmigiano. Luckily I didn't and tryed it first. It was so salty which means they use a lot of salt in their sauce. Too much for my taste. Then I noticed they use too much corn meal on the bottom. Then as I ate my way to the crust I realized the crust tasted like bread. So I was severely disappointed as to get to this place if you are driving is extremely difficult as there is no parking Anywhere around the place. So I will never go back for a slice but one day I will try a whole pie fresh from the oven when the main restaurant is open.
author: James F.

description:
So first off the The Pizza is HELLA good, A1, top-shelf. Whenever i think of north beach i immediately think of Tony's. and not only is the food really good but the staff is also real friendly. I go in there a lot (i work in the area) and they always show me love. It's a good feeling. 
I've also never had a Stromboli until i found out about this place..and the Stromboli there tastes like God's Hot Pocket. Heavenly. Keep up the good work and i'll see you guys for my next slice!
author: Carey J.

description:
Okay, where does this review go?  Tony's Pizza Napoletana, or the Slice House, where I actually went?  I'll just write two reviews!

So, does Tony's transport me back to NY?  No.  But Tony's does get me almost there, maybe as far as PA. This is no foo foo pizza joint, and I didn't get a salad on top of either slice.  Today's selection was the NY Cheese and Margherita slices.   

The Cheese slice (my NY hopeful) looked the part, with some beautiful (albeit unhealthy) grease on top from the cheese and sauce.  After dabbing the excess grease off with my napkin, I picked it up and folded it!  Yes, that's right.  For you non-New Yorkers, that is how a real slice of pizza is eaten.  The crust was excellent, crispy enough and thin enough to be noticed under the usual goodies.  The cheese and sauce were good, but this is where it missed the NY boat.  Regardless, the total package was yummy and worthy of the 4 stars.

The Margherita was very saucy, but in a good way.  There was just enough cheese and the small blob of basil that seemed to be dropped in one place just needed to be spread out to provide a tasty bite each time.  This wasn't your standard Margherita, but I liked it anyway.  Taste over substance wins in this case.
author: Larry Z.

description:
I want to like this place. The pizza is East Coast Good, and that's hard to find out here in California. However after going in on two occasions and having the rudest, most obnoxious experience with the staff - it's just not worth the abuse.

Today's experience comes courtesy of the staff who gave my child a cup of water with crumbs and other floating things in the cup.

My child is 12, I sent him and a couple friends over to grab slices after school as a treat for end of semester. 

When he asked for a new cup of water, the staff member said "Why do you have to be so F*&*($#* needy?"

To a 12 year old who asked for clean water.

Nice. 

Thanks for the pizza, we're over.
author: Amber L.

description:
Usually like to eat at Rogue Brewery when in the Fisherman's Wharf area, never realized Tony's was only a block away! As much as I love pizza, my wife is from Illinois and we couldn't pass up an opportunity to try what sound like 'authentic' Chicago Italian Beef sandwiches. Walked up the hill from the wharf on a hot Sunday, got their around 3:30pm, waited in line. Place is a hole in the wall, only real seating was outside in the sun. My wife was particularly excited to hear that they served a 'combo' (Italian beef and sausage) as that is what she always has when she is in Illinois. We reach the counter, my wife orders a combo, the woman steps away for a few moments then comes back and tells us they are out of sausages, so they can't make a combo. 3:30... out of sausages? It would probably be best not to include items on the menu that they don't have a serious intention on being able to serve. UNFORTUNATELY, this was my first experience with a Tony Gemignani restaurant and from the number of restaurants that he now has, I must wonder if he has spread himself to thin. 

Tried to leave a CONTACT on the main restaurant website, but despite trying three different browsers, I never received any indication it went through...
author: Rsng F.

description: Had a slice of the Meat Lover's and it was really good. A little pricey for a slice and they didn't have garlic bread the day I went, but a positive experience overall.
author: Patty O.

description:
I heard that Tony's slices burn your mouth with every bite. Fortunately, not the case with my experience, because my slice of California was just lukewarm. 

Loved all the fresh veggies but for $5 it was a little steep. Customer service was great. I will return!
author: Nora L.

description: Sober munching, drunk munching, any kind of munching; Tony's is on point. The crust is magical, crispy but not burnt and withstands the delicious cheesy combo that Tony's uses. Truly, I can't thank Tony's enough for saving me from a drunken stupor. The late night slice house is perfect for those on the go and you really can't beat the location. Grab a slice (or three like me) and sit outside and people watch. No need to be proper, dig into that big cheesy slice of heaven.
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is the most delectable pizza I have ever eaten. The crust of the award-winning margherita pizza has a complex and delicately balanced flavor. Non-crust eaters would be foolish to stick by their guns at this joint.
Tony's has too venues- one on the corner that is a classy sit-down and has waits over an hour and then this one which has take out slices, a booth, and an authentic neighborhood vibe in contrast to the touristy feel of North Beach.
Fun Facts:
-Tony's only makes 73 margherita pizzas a day in honor of the award that it won in Italy in 1973
-The combinations include quail eggs, burrata, and truffle but none of the pizzas have pineapple because "Tony doesn't like it"
-The menu notes the temperature and type of oven that each pizza is baked at
author: Karlyn M.

description: What kind of pizza place has no pepperoni pizza available at 6pm? Ridiculous! They had no replacement options either for delivery. Fantastic customer service.
author: Rosa A.

description: Other reviews helped my decision to go with a slice of NY meat lovers.  Did not disappoint! DELISH! Crust was crispy, flavors terrific!  The best $5.50 I spent in SF! It was late afternoin, so not a long wait. Sat outside at a small table & struck conversation with other Pizza lovers! Will definitely make this a go-to place when I come to the City!
author: JM C.

description:
update: too much cornmeal! gross mouthfeel! Tony seems to have lost his focus.


Very good slices.. nice crunch on the crust... good cornmeal bite.. a little thicker than perfect for me.. hence only 4 stars.  Very good flavor on the sauce!
author: Josh K.

description: Tony's makes the BEST New York-style style pizza in SF, and when you go to Slice House you don't have to wait an hour and 45 minutes just to sit down like you would next door at TPN. It took us 10 minutes to reach the front of the line to place our order, and our pie came out in about another 10 minutes (even though they warned us it might take 30 minutes). The individual slices come out even faster, in a matter of minutes. The New Yorker is my favorite-- pepperoni, sausage, ricotta, and tomato sauce. The crust is crispy and you can really taste that it was cooked in a coal-fired oven. Simple but amazing!
author: Carmen T.

description: I have been here dozens of times. I don't even live in the Bay Area, visit often stay in danville and make the drive. The last 3 times the woman who answers the phone for phone orders is so needlessly rude! I asked her a question Saturday night, she chuckled  sarcastically and placed me on hold for 7 more minutes until a man came on and I could tell that he was expecting me to be rude.  She was rude in person behind the cash register too. What's the deal lady, people have questions, you are rushed, we are sitting in traffic driving to a place with parking restrictions up the wazoo  etc etc- exert some customer service and patience it will make everyone happier and create a more positive experience.
author: LC Lou C.

description:
To be fair, I lived in italy for a decade so rarely am I impressed by pizza in the states (especially for the crazy prices people charge for basically some flour, cheese and tomato sauce)...so this review is for Tony's overalll...been here about 10 times, but went last n7ght and now feel I should Yelp it...

1 star for the pizza (the only pizza by the slice that looks edible and is usually the freshest is the NY cheese)...good crunchy crust, big slices, tasty cheese and not too pricey (although $3.75 plus tax and being charged for a box isn't cheap)

1 star for the outdoor seating, which is a nice bonus, very casual and no need to get on a waiting list, just sit if there's free table

1star is for the very calm, collected, over-worked and patient young woman working at the counter (her name is Alexandra)...it was a Saturday night around 7:30pm, beautiful warm weather outside, tons of people walking around, tons of tourists, and as usual on a weekend a long line out the door for a slice...no problem, it's fun to be outside, talk with friends, people watch...we finally get to the front (after about 4 people took off from not wanting to wait around anymore...it took about 15+ minutes...when get to the cashier order, the woman I referred to had to answer the phone for pickup orders...WHAT!? We waited all that time, there were 6 people behind the counter working and the same person taking all in house orders, payments, complaints, and re-stocking the counter is ALSO answering the phone on the busiest night of the week! She patently answered the phone, then had to go the back for a minute to deliver the order to whomever, then came back with a smile and tried to help us when 3 people m8ved us aside amd asked for this amd that...she was calm and polite, then apologized for the wait...we graciously thanked her for her hard work and keeping a smile as it seemes she was doing most of the work herself...then j6st after we got our slices, someone yelled out to a line of about 12 or more people that they weren't taking orders anymore for slices to go, because "they're really slammed next door with pizza orders! REALLY!? I know they're owned by the same people, but the fact that they have two different names, buildings, entrances, addresses, styles and seating always looked like they don't exactly depend on each other, especially when there are 6 people behind the counter just in the tiny slice shop...so where are all the people who work in the restaurant/pizzeria? And Tony operates 2 popular spots in the center of Little Italy, that's always full of locals and tons of tourists...so why would they be so badly managed, unprepared, and even turn customers away directly!? That's just bad business, rude to the customers and unfair to the staff...Come on, Tony's, you make a gold mine for average to goodish pizza, so get your act together, at least for the locals like myself who would like to come here more than once...
author: kelly b.

description:
I am new to pizza, but I love this place.   

Everything smells so good here, and I can order what I want to because there are so many choices on the menu.
author: Yang Q.

description: One slice of pizza is equivalent to two! Slide is as big as my head, and worth $5. Loved it and loved the outdoor seating. Nice comfortable place in North Beach.
author: Vanessa G.

description: I've been looking for a thin crust pizza that's perfectly crisp, not the typical bland and doughy tasting - finally found it at the take-out section two doors down from the restaurant. The pepperoni pizza slice with a crisp crust was tasty. We also ordered the veggie and sausage one to eat the next day. Quick and easy ordering process without a wait.
author: Lana C.

description: The service was awful. I waited 13 minutes for one slice of margarita and she finally tells me that they don't have any more left. Then she gave me a slice of cheese with basil on it- it tasted like tomato sauce out if a can. I don't recommend this place.
author: Sarah P.

description: This is the take out/ slice restaurant of the world famous Tony's. Now they claim it's the same kitchen but I am but sure. Tried three different slices - Sicilian convo, California veggie and pepperoni. They all were good but fell way short of what you would call world class. Do yourself a favor and go to golden boy around the corner!
author: Rohit B.

description: The Slice House is a quick place to get a great slice of pizza. The service is good and the pizza is amazing. My first week in North Beach I ate here three times haha. Their cheese pizza reminds me of good old NYC pizza. Can't go wrong grabbing a slice here.
author: Nicole E.

description: Avoid the wait at the (spectacularly delicious) full-service restaurant next door and get a slice of pizza here! They have a good selection of slices, but I definitely recommend the Picante. We were able to order a kids spaghetti for my daughter and a salad for me off the main restaurant's regular menu. That part took about 30 minutes, but it was worth the wait. This is the best pizza in SF!
author: Maria L.

description: Got a NY Meat Lovers slice. Yeah, it's $5 a pop, but it's worth it because it's delicious. Grab one and enjoy it on the parklet outside.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Saw Tonys pizza on TV & decided to stop here while we were in town. The restaurant had a wait of 1hr45min & we were starving so we went next door & ordered the margherita pizza...yummm! It was one of the best! Will definitely be back when we are craving pizza!
author: Stephanie M.

description: They charge you for your box.  Really? When I'm buying three slices that cost you $3 to make and you charged me $15. Cmon guys.
author: David S.

description: Best pizza in town. Bar none. The cheese the sauce. No frills just darn great pizza. Yelp wants me to write more. Well here goes. The closest pizza to a down home right NYC pizza or the tri state area. This pizza is by far ahead off all the pizza joints in sf. You don't believe it? Try it and judge.
author: Jorydude r.

description: Very tasty, but oily and limited selection of by the slice pizza.  I would definitely go back, but I think ordering a whole pizza pie might be the way to go...
author: Brian M.

description: Unbelievably rude service from the blond witch behind the register. She claimed to be the manager when we asked to speak to one, but I highly doubt Tony's would appoint someone as immature and condescending to run this shop. If you hate your job, go somewhere else.
author: Annie C.

description:
Let me start by stating that I'm a Tony's fan and that the pizza itself is awesome and deserves a 4 or 4.5 rating. This review is about the damned weirdest experience we had a month ago at the counter. We showed up there on a weekday, maybe 15-20 minutes before closing. I hadn't had my NY pizza fix and had to have a slice. I was disappointed to discover that the remaining selection of about 7 or 8 random slices was pretty limited (no cheese, mostly unusual CA toppings), but I compromised when the woman behind the counter brusquely told us too bad, this all we have.  Another party walked in behind us, saw the limited selection, asked if that was it, and walked out. Our two slices were reheated hastily, and weren't as hot as they should be, but fine, like I said, I'm a Tony's fan. As we devoured them, at least two more groups of two walked in, and formed a line. When someone in the first group started asking about the limited selection, the woman behind the counter got all pissed, yelled something like "You know what?!" and -- in front of a line of waiting customers -- swept all the remaining slices INTO THE GARBAGE, and announced in a loud voice "WE'RE CLOSED!" and stormed away from the counter.  Everyone looked at each other, scowled, and walked out. It was still 5 minutes before closing. While it's true that a little entertainment during meals often enhances the dining experience, in truth I was really angry with how all these people were treated, including myself.  Absolutely, incredibly unprofessional behavior, to say the least.

SO LISSEN UP TONY !!

If this is your policy, you gotta re-think it TODAY. Understand that it's a NORMAL cost of business to have a few slices left over at the end of the day. Build it into the price if you have to. And you gotta plan for the fact that some days are unpredictably busier than others, and that sometimes there can be a small rush before closing because, you know, you're closing.  And if this isn't your policy, you've got yourself a serious EMPLOYEE problem that needs to be addressed soon before she pisses off enough other people to damage your reputation, which is what keeps your business thriving.
author: Richard A.

description: I've heard great things about Tony's pizza and was excited to hear about their pizza by the slice shop. But be warned, options are limited and service was disordered and rude. As a tourist or a local, (I'm a local) I'm disappointed. North beach has other great places for lower costs too.
author: Rose S.

description: Enjoyed the thin crust coal fire pizza, not my favorite tho. Overall is beautifully cooked. Its kind of pricy I like pizza with many different tops and they have somewhat limited choices.
author: Ye L.

description:
DELICIOUS. Found by accident walking around Little Italy area looking for pizza by the slice. Tried the NY Cheese, Pepperoni and Meat Lover's. Perfect flavor on sauce and right amount of cheese.

Small place , but you can sit outside. Busy but order is up quickly and employees warm, helpful and friendly. They were very busy and lot of workers in a small kitchen but great attitude. I had better customer service here than snobby rude servers in Tiburon earlier in the day in a pricier sit-down restaurant.
author: holly L.

description: Went to check out the church at Washington Square when I saw a lady with a huge pizza box. I asked her where she got it and she said "Tony's down the street". My family and I walked over to the pizza shop and were at awe of the slices. We ordered 2 pepperoni and a meat lovers. We also ordered the cheese sticks which they said would take a few minutes due to them not being pre-made. To say that the pizza was awesome is an understatement! The crust was just crispy but not too hard and had this amazing taste! My wife asked the very nice young lady how much longer for the breadsticks due to having to park at a meter a block away. The wait was worth it! The breadsticks were just as awesome and the young lady gave us some meatballs for waiting which also tasted like a "small piece of heaven". We will definitely return back to this spot and make sure I take plenty of quarters for the meter. Thank you guys for an amazing slice of pizza that will always remind me of your beautiful city and people, keep doing what your doing because your doing it just right.
author: Johnny B.

description: This place is legit. Why wait an hour for a table when you can go next door and eat immediately? Among the best pizza in the bay area, a distinct style that stands out even among great company.  The meat sauce was tremendous. The crust superbly satisfying and toasty, with different styles carefully described
author: Mike L.

description: The best slice of margharita (spelling?) pizZa I've ever had. So nice to get it to go and eat it in the park. Kept hearing Tonys is the best pizza in town and I'm not disappointed.
author: Andrea K.

description: Worst pizza in San Francisco!  I had this pizza last Saturday evening.  Tasteless Margherita pizza slice.  Had 2 small mozzarella cheese mounds the size of a fifty cent piece on top of canned tomato sauce and slivers of basil.  Didn't taste like real mozzarella.  Their crust is hard also.  Worst is the cashier who shorted me 4 cents and told me he didn't have 4 pennies to give me.  I could have given him the pennies if he only told me; but he quickly ignore me and went on to the next customer.  He must do this to all the customers. I don't find this right -- it's the principal of the thing.  Never will I give business to this pizza place the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Betty S.

description: Get that damn margarita pizza and don't look back! A few others were good but damn that margarita!!! I see myself going back a little too offen, fml! Def best margarita I had in the 18 years in sf!
author: jasmin t.

description: Went to Tony ' s sit down restaurant last night. A 2 hr wait made us step out and head to the Tony 's next door which serves pizza by the slice. Same stuff, shorter lines. We got cheese, margherita, pirate and pepperoni. Each one was good. Thin crispy on the edge crust, excellent sauce (tart like tomatoes taste) and with perfectly crisped pepperoni. Almost like bacon. Loved it. Would go next time and sit in the park and eat :)
author: Vipul H.

description: I was walking thru the neighborhood and wanted to grab a slice to hold me over.  Thanks to Yelp, I found Tony's and the restaurant looked nice, and the slice place next door had outdoor seating.  Ordered my slice ($4 for a slice o' pep) and enjoyed sitting outside.  The slice was... it was hot.  Not so much cheese.  If the slice had been $3 (like in NYC), I probably would have given 3 stars.  For 4 bucks, nope....  It just wasn't that good or that big.
author: Sasha D.

description: Friendly staff, amazing pizza. Asked cashier what he would recommend for a slice and he recommended Picante Pizza. And trust me. It's so worth it!!! Not spicy just take out the jalapeños. And eat them on the side. My family had all meat, cheese and a stromboli . All of the food was delicious!
author: Letty R.

description: Had the artichoke joe pizza and absolutely loved it! I keep a journal of my pizza experiences and this pie rated highly.
author: Scott C.

description: The pizza is thin crust but too chrispy that I couldnt enjoy the flavor too much due to too much chewing. I paid almost $5 for one slice that was ok. Wouldnt come again. Not many veggie options either.
author: Sahira B.

description: Love it when I find a NY pizza that tastes right on the left coast. They save me so much money on airfare I feel like I should leave a huge tip. Just kiddin. Tony's Coal oven pumps out top quality pies that would stay in business even if it was located in mid town manhattan.
author: Crazy Bernie S.

description: went through the slice house and had very quick service. pizza was very good...deservingly on the one of the top pizza spots in the country. i still like NY style pizza but a good second alternative.
author: Anish P.

description: The Tonys restaurant was too busy so they suggested we come next door. The pizza slices did not disappoint!  Got a couple slices to go and had delicious pizza!
author: Ingrid B.

description: Tony's is always popping'. I got there late today and there were no more Sicillian slices. I opted for the meat lover's, each slice was 5.50 and they heat it up quickly. I love how the pizza including the crust was crunchy, but the oil seeped through my plate. Next time I will try other toppings!
author: Nancy Y.

description: Hands down our fav place in the Bay to grab a slice! Can't go wrong with the classic's cheese or pepperoni. Just wish they delivered because I'd be on that each week. Maybe that's a good thing.....
author: Bri R.

description: I went to Tonys finally. Dirty dirty place ( pizza shop) and my pizzas were literally mostly black char on the bottom and very soggy. Not impressed and customer service? What can I expect from 20 something's ? Hmm maybe some acknowledgment since I just waited for my $50 worth of crappy pizza
author: Aubrey P.

description: The pizza is seriously fantastic and the workers are all great too. They also have a good variety of choices for a good price. The best part is all of the available seating outside. Even if it's crowded inside, the line moves along pretty quickly. I love the California Style Pizza!
author: Joshua V.

description: Awesome Stuff!  Must try pizza!  Best I've ever had in bay area!  Not that I've eatten a lot in my life, but this was is memorable!  I'm glad there is one in the bay area!  :)
author: Cristina R.

description:
I had actually planned to eat at the Tony's Neopolitana, but after getting there I discovered that they were closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Disappointed, I was about to turn back when I noticed this place. 

I walked in and they were selling slices of pizza along with items like Stromboli. I wanted a slice of Margherita pizza (to tide me over for an hour while I explore other restaurants) only to be told that it was not available as the restaurant was closed. More disappointment!  So I ordered a slice of NY  Cheese pizza. It was $3.75 plus taxes. The person put the slice in a revolving oven of some sort and presto!  Out comes a delicious slice of pizza. It was excellent tasting with right crunch, texture and a beautiful finish!  I loved it so much that I decided to ditch my expedition to explore other restaurants and just have a few more slices. I ordered a slice of California ($5 plus taxes) and another slice of NY Cheese to go. By the time I reached my hotel (near Clay and Battery), the pizza got cold. In hindsight, I should have eaten it right there. But the temptation of eating pizza and watching the Mavericks play the Spurs in the NBA playoffs from the comfort of my hotel room was too tempting.  Still the pizza tasted really good. 

I would come here again in a heartbeat!
author: Gopal R.

description: Tonys pizza is the closest thing we've had to New York pizza in SF. We went to Tonys on a Sunday late afternoon when the weather was beautiful outside. Bypassed the 50 minute wait to sit by getting pizza by the slice instead. We were served pretty quickly and ate our pizza in the park which was great. But a couple of customers had been waiting north of 30 minutes for the pies they ordered. And the staff wasn't great at being proactive and handling customer service. Recommend not ordering a whole pie unless you're doing delivery.
author: Rebecca G.

description: The guy that works the cashier is very rude, he threw the menu at us when we asked if they had a menu. I don't blame him though it's not easy working a job like that
author: David S.

description: Great pizza, and so thankful for the convenience of the slice house!  I stopped by on my own and got friendly, quick service.  Also glad that they take credit cards, handy for a traveler.
author: Virginia L.

description: I really really like this pizza spot. It's delicious and a little fancy -- for $4+ a slice, it had better be, right? I think I've only had a plain or chicken pizza there but never have I ordered a full pie -- something I'm looking forward to doing soon! I want to expose more people to this deliciousness! Thin crust for the win!
author: Ayele A.

description: Bf and I were in the area and wanted good pizza and decided to come in here. There was a line to order and you order by the slice or you can order a whole pizza I believe. I got a cheese slice and bf got a combo. They were both really good the ingredients are nice and fresh. Will be back to try other ones that looked good.
author: arlene d.

description:
The margherita pizza is wonderful. The tomato sauce is delicious, the crust is thin and crispy, and the slice is never greasy. They've also got some tables outdoors to enjoy a nice day, or you can take your food to Washington Square Park. 

It can be a long wait for the restaurant, so if you are in a rush or on a tight budget, just go to the slice house instead!
author: Julia W.

description: Tony's is excellent - all the pizza and all the food.  But what is really amazing is the Chicago style hot roast beef sandwiches.  You can only get the beef at the Slice House next door to Tony's  - they don't sell the Chicago beef at Tony's.  They slow roast beef for hours and it's great. The sandwich is huge, so go hungry.
author: Michael S.

description: Love the calzone.  We were starving and did not want to wait for a table at Tony's Pizza Napoletana next door.  No need.  The food here is delicious if you want a quick bite and no fuss.  Slices, calzones and stromboli's are served in boxes.  Brilliant.  I always order too much food because they all look so good to me and I could never decide, just order all.  When you are done eating, just fold the top over and take it home.  The crust is so delicious.  I have a soft spot for calzones and I must order one if available.  The meat cheese and ricotta combination were perfect.  However, I could only eat half in one sitting.  I took the remaining half and the extra slice home.  Ate those the next day at lunch and although it was good, it definitely does not compared to the hot and fresh served at the restaurant.  There is only one banquette table inside the restaurant because this is basically a take out place, there are about 5 tables outside and there were a few available when we came.  This is my new favorite calzone.  Thank you.
author: t d.

description: When time is limited, I always try to make a pit stop here. Besides the plain cheese, there are several interesting combinations. Love the chorizo when available. Good dough. People watching is a plus. I like listening to the silly tourist comments about the style of pizza. If it looks good and there's a line, just shut up and enjoy the pie
author: J L.

description: The wait was 1hr & 45min next door, so we decided to get a slice here.  It was sooooo good.  Definitely coming back.
author: O. A.

description: apparently veggie slices these days have peperoni on top, anyways , guy at the counter should host the show on Mtv ridiculousness , he really knows how to run a show ( not being sarcastic at all ) , anyways horrible service to get a slice of pizza that you actually did not ask for , less cheese more dough on the Sicilian , hope will get to try the thin crust next time and I have a decent person talking to me at the counter.
author: NAEL K.

description: I've only dined in once but usually just call in an order for pick-up.  You can't go wrong with the New Yorker pizza.  It only comes in one size but it's well worth it.
author: Lenniebelle E.

description: Best pizza by the slice I've found in SF so far. Brings back memories of NY pizzerias - great crust, outstanding cheese, and wonderfully tasty sauce.
author: Braden S.

description: This place is amazing! My favorite pizza place, slices are huge! It can get busy tho but worth it!
author: Daniel R.

description: Definitely a top-5 pizza for me.  And the Stromboli was pretty darn delicious too.
author: Jason B.

description: Had a friend visiting from out of town so we wanted to bring him to the arguably best pizza place in San Francisco. Too bad we waited 45 minutes for the margherita pizza, they forgot our order, and sold out all of their margherita slices. We saw people with 50+ numbers ahead of us walking out with our pizza and we didn't get any. We got a refund but thanks a lot for wasting our time.
author: Pamela S.

description: Great place for a quick bite without breaking the bank.  Husband and I shared 2 slices and a soda - fed 2 of us for $7.  A nice change of pace in a pretty expensive city.  Slices reminded us of NY pizza - although not exactly.
author: Marie H.

description: Stumbled upon this place as we were walking Little Italy. Got the New York Meat Lovers. Just WOW!!! Amazing!  Packed so slice house is fine
author: Karym P.

description: We ended up here after we were told that the wait for Tony's Pizza Napoletana next door would be an hour and 45 minute at almost 9pm. I had a slice of pepperoni pizza and a slice of Sicilian pizza with onions & meats. My husband had two slices of cheese. I thought that my pizza was excellent, especially the Sicilian. My husband said his was good. It's a small little restaurant with only one table inside but several outside. The only complaint is that if you order the pizza by the slice it's not fresh. It's taken from a glass case and reheated in the oven. However, that's to be expected when you order by the slice. We were originally looking for fresh pizza but this was way better than waiting almost 2 hours.
author: Meghan M.

description: Best pizza best service. my son's pizza fell down and I wanted to buy him a new one. They immediately gave me a new one free. The pizza was super tasty !!! I would definitely come again.
author: Dina B.

description: I wish I could give negative stars because this would be the only possible rating this place would deserve!!! We ordered a slice of Margherita but we got red burnt card board for $5.5. I am Italian, and in 10 years in San Francisco I was never so deeply disappointed with a slice of pizza like today. I would rather go to Round table pizza or pizza hut than here!! The worst quality for a ludicrous price!
author: Rossella M.

description: I have to say, I've been going to a lot of different pizza joints in north beach, and Tonys is definitely among the best. The taste of the bread, sauce, and cheese are unique and delicious. Service is what you would expect from a slice house, quick greeting, take your order and on to the next person. Very satisfied with this place, definitely will recommend it and bring friends.
author: Robert D.

description: Just as great as the full restaurant next door.  The majority of the pizzas for the restaurant are actually cooked in the slice house, so the quality is always there.  I like how they have expanded the menu to more of the items on the full restaurant menu.  Its a great spot for people who don't want to have to wait for the restaurant (wait times can easily exceed 90 minutes on a weekend).  The classic pepperoni pizza and the New Yorker are my two favorites, definitely worth a trip to find out for yourself!
author: Brian L.

description: Showed up here late on a weeknight and we had a slice of NY cheese and pepperoni.  Slices were nice and crisp and were served up quick.  Nice to have this quick to-go storefront when not being able to wait for a seat @ the full service Tony's next door.
author: Eric T.

description: On a recent trip to the Bay Area, we were craving pizza one night and Yelped restaurants in the area. We were actually looking for a sit down restaurant and had put our name in next door (Tony's). We were told the wait was about 65 minutes. Being that it was almost 8:00pm and we had our two small girls with us, who were starving, we ventured next door. To our surprise we found out that they were one in the same. Sharing the same kitchen and offering the same food. We lucked out and snatched up the only booth inside. There are a few patio tables outside but it was chilly and packed. We ordered a couple of slices of pizza, an order of calamari, and a spaghetti. Great food and excellent pizza. After we finished our meal we noticed the party that was in front of us next door was still waiting for a table. Not being from the area they were recommended to us by the concierge at our hotel. Now I see why this is a favorite among locals.
author: Jason P.

description: Tony's came highly recommended to me. I went there with great expectations and I can see why people really love the place. I just liked it. The crust was my greatest problem. It was soft and bready thin crust.  The crust reminded me of Naan bread, not pizza crust. The Ribiola pizza was very good with the exception of the crust. We also had a Marguerita pizza which was quite tasty but the sauce was thin and runny. We got each a glass of chianti and barbera which had zero complexity yet for $8/$9 a glass I would have liked SOME complexity. They also were served warm which did not help. Had the prices been 30% less I might have opted for 4 stars but the price performance ratio is not here.
author: Barry F.

description: 4 stars for pizza, 1 for attitude of pizza chefs! I was in SF last week and someone told me about this place so I gave it a try. I was told it was the 'best' and that Toni had won awards in Italy or something. Having lived in NYC for the past 3 years I had high expectations but I'm not a pizza snob by any means. I went to the window and ordered a slice of pepperoni - a pretty good marker to review a slice. It was pretty damn good. No use going into it and having a pizza debate but for me this did it! Base is slightly thicker than NY style but that's ok. It was nice and chewy. Pepperoni was really nice and best of all it was not too oily. Cheese and sauce ratio perfect. Overall 9/10 for the pizza. The price is a whopping $4.50 a slice tho!! The staff behind the counter were rather arrogant, as if eating a slice was a huge privilege or smtg. A bit of a weird vibe. I would definitely recommend you give it a try.
author: Phin L.

description: The pizza is one of a kind delicious! highly recommend, especially the thick sicilian pizza. Try any of the pizzas is is really experience :)
author: M G.

description: Went here at noon on Friday.  I was able to get a seat in the one booth inside this little joint, most other patrons chose a table outside.  I ordered a single slice of Mahgarita pizza and a 20 oz soda for $7. Very nice staff.  I heard so many great things about Tony's so my expectations were high.  Here is what I thought of the slice:  barely warm, nice crust (texture & taste), but the "sauce" tasted like simple tomato paste.  The cheese was softened but not melted.  Just round slices.  Did I eat the whole thing?  Yes.  Would I go back?  Nope.  I would give another North Beach pizza place a try first...
author: J W.
